text:
Had it next to the alesmith speedway which was a little better. This one has more heat and maybe oats. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dobre piwo, ale niczego nie urywa. Mocno wytrawne i kawowe. Ładna piana, fajnie gęste. Ale ot taki zwykły RIS.

355ml bottle @ Pudel. 
Poured pitch black with a thin brown head. 
Dark fruity, dark chocolate, ashy aroma, wood quite much. 
Flavor has dark chocolate, roasted malt, ash, tobacco, wood. Sweet finish, lingering long chocolate finish. Long warming finish. Slow sipper.

Tried on tap for the first time, lives up the the hype. Nothing in this beer is too dominate and every flavor blends well. A fantastic stout that almost seems too simple, but keep drinking and you'll keep finding more in this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska. Svart med ett gulbeigt skum. Dofter av kaffe, choklad och lakrits. Smakinslag av kaffe, choklad, alkohol, aska och rostad malt. Oljig munkänsla, fyllig kropp.

How: Bottle.
Where: Had at home.
Appearance: Black colour with a thick beige head.
Aroma: Chocolate, caramel, some coffee, vanilla, spices, some alcohol.
Body: Full body, low carbonation. Thick mouthfeel.
Flavour: Chocolate, caramel, spices, vanilla, some liquorice, a bit vinous,
 some warming alcohol.

One of the best American Imperial Stouts I've tasted!
Thick, creamy & luscious body.
Tastes of bitter chocolate & coffee! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2014 version on tap pours black with dark tan head aroma and taste is coffee and chocolate with a touch of booze alot more than that going on but thiose were the main components to me, very nice.

Dark brown, quite nice head. Aroma: caramel, biscuits, coffee, gingerbread, nit soy sauce. Medium to full body, heavy sweetness, medium to low bitterness. Lots of sweetness, but even more coffee and roasted notes, some dry fruits and licorice, Perfectly hidden alcohol. Overal very balanced, maybe bit too much roastiness.

Bottle from Beersnmore, bottled 11/06/15. Pours almost black, hints of brown, little head. Aroma is dark dried fruit, plum, chocolate, raisin. Body is quite heavy, sweet and warmingly boozy with only a little carbonation - Not flat and not lacking anything, though. Chocolate is even intenser here, other roasted malts too, but there is still dark fruit present. Some soy sauce. Palate lingers on chocolate and bitterness. Still warming and boozy. A sipper for sure. Good balance. Great!

butelka 2015, aromat i smak bardzo mocno palonych słodów, deserowej czekolady, kawy, kakao, troszeczkę wanilii i ciemnych owoców, konkretna palona goryczka, lekko popiołowa, alkohol konkretnie rozgrzewa w przełyku, gęsta faktura. Solidny RIS, ale bez fajerwerków, w zasadzie ta cena porywa.

Bottle, september 18th 2016. Black body with a massive tanned head. Aroma of cocoa, dark fruit, roasted malt. Taste is bittersweet and rich, hazelnut, dark chocolate, raisin. Thick delicious body, with a lasting dark roasty end. Very nice!

December 13th, 2014 - Bells Expedition Stout feels like part of a panther at this point. Classic, well known, and an established reputation, its small wonder I dont have the Expedition Stout with more frequency, save for the previous barrier of being in a part of the country where Bells didnt distribute. The Expedition Stout advertises its unctuous intensity from the pour, slow and oily, like pouring a thick dark nectar into the glass. And there it sits like an anchor, unperturbed, with just a thin, soy-sauce like foam on top, barely a quarter of a centimeter. This allows the heavy aroma to unfurl from the brew, like the Old Rasputin but darker. Notes of charcoal, pine can and steak fond, with a licorice lacquer. The flavor is even more engaging, with a forward boozy quality that is strong by restrained. The heavy flavor oozes with a long, delicious caramel flavor and licorice aftertaste, direct and exquisitely balanced. Not especially complex, the flavors are direct and candid, but also harmonious.

I love this beer. The first time I had it was watching a Bruins game while at a secluded beach shack of a bar in FL (13). This beer pours black in color with a tan head. Chocolate, caramel, roast aromas. Thick and intense flavor; immensely chocolatey with roast edges that hit hard in the cheeks but then coats the mouth and lingers. This is really just a classic in the style and amazingly stands above so many that have come along since.

Notes: 14 bottle opened Apr 17

A perfect imperial stout.
Aroma is so rich, it has almost everything nice ini it - dark chocolate, hazelnuts, ceamed coffee, toffe, freshly cooked bread, dark plums...
The taste is undescribable, it is just pure happiness in a bottle... So, I wont try to describe it as I know I cant find any righ words for it.
This beer feels almost velvety in mouth and leaves an aftertaste of honey and propolis.
I am astonished. This is my favourite beer for now. This... this cant be brewed by simply humans. Looks like Gambrius himself has given an helping hand to the brewers at Bells.

Bottle 355 ml / Craftgallery - Bern (CH). Black and fat beer with an average tan head. Roasted aromas, chocolate-coffee, dark fruits are the beginnings of an amazing tasting. To the taste, its the same with fruity of candied cherry, caramel-molasses-maple, vanilla touch. As it aged moderatly, the flavors of malt and hop are ideally melted to perfection. A great moment.

330 ml bottle at Wild Turkey, Castelgomberto (VI), Italy. Colour is black with a small long lasty, creamy brown head. Aroma is chocolate, spices, pepper, coffee, smoked, roaste malts, liqorice, dark fruits. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, resins. Medium sweet. Body is full, creamy texture, average carbonation. Finish is warm and long.

Bottle. 10.5%. No best before date, but packaged on 11.06.15. Pours an oily black, with a dark tan head. Slight lacing. Somewhat fat aroma, roasted, with light rye and dark fruit notes, the latter increasing a bit as it warms. Metallic hint, and a hint of whisky deep down as well. Further warming brings out some kind of minty touch. Flavour is fat, almost chewy, slightly tart, roasted, with notes of liquorice, rye, dark fruits. Hint of hops in the background. Roasted, dark fruits finish with a medium alcohol burn and a mild bitterness, hinting at dark chocolate. Lingering light grassy note. Smooth palate. Overall really good. If anything, it could do with a bit more complexity in aroma and flavour, but its still so well-made and -balanced, that it doesnt really matter. 20.04.17.

Pitch black pour with a medium height espresso head . Smells like cocoa,vanilla milk chocolate,roasted malts,dry cherries. Very smooth texture with low carbonation and taste notes that include cocoa beans, espresso, roasted malts and dark chocolate ,vanilla. Very well balanced and just the perfect mouthfeel.

2015. Cholernie się utleniło, czego nie lubię w RIS-ach. Dałbym sobie rękę uciąć, że świeże jest lepsze i mam w planach takie spróbować w przyszłości. Poszło mocno w czerwone owoce i śliwki. Obecnie największym atutem tego piwa jest jego ciało, gęstość porównywalna z olejem silnikowym, wykleja aż miło. Niestety, to utlenienie mnie męczyło i piwo z kretesem przegrało bezpośrednie starcie z rok świeższym Black Note. Do zobaczenia za jakiś czas.

Zapach intensywny, paloność, kakao, czekolada, praliny, kawa, lukrecja, alkohol. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana beżowa, niska, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, szybko znika, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, pełne, gęste, paloność, czekolada, kakao, kawa, lukrecja, suszone owoce, wanilia, alkohol. Goryczka wysoka, wysycenie niskie.

Aroma- lots of notes of caramel and delicious stoutyness 

Appearance- dark

Taste- full bodied, like a meal even compared to other stouts, heavy like motor oil (in a good way) large notes of caramel and malt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Roasted malt with smoke and fruity sweetness. 
Flavour: Dark roasted malt with chocolate notes and fruity sweetness. Aftertaste is malty with notes of coffee and rather bitter. Mouthfeel is creamy and alcoholic warm. 
Colour: black with a brown head.
Z: biszkopt, może ciut sosu sojowego, lekkie alko. S: średnie ciało, słodko, biszkopty, lekki kwasek śliwki. Finisz delikatny w czekoladę.

Közepes, tartós hab, fekete szín. Illata csokis, kávés, aszalt gyümölcsös. Selymes, csokoládés, kissé kávés és nagyon sötét bogyós gyümölcsös karakter, markáns hordós aromákkal, pici vörösboros beütéssel. Hatalmas test jellemzi, enyhe szénsavtartalommal és közepes keserűvel, amit a tölgyfa és a pörkölt maláta ad. Isteni sör, nagyszerű arányokkal és egyensúllyal.
W zapachu ciasto czekoladowe, rodzynki i trochę alkoholu. W smaku karmel, gorzka czekolada i palona goryczka.

355ml bottle.  Bottled on 09/02/15. Glugs out of the bottle black with a thin head the colour of brown sugar. On the nose, molasses, dark chocolate syrup, Nilla wafer, light dried cherries, and a very small hit of resinous notes. Whoa. Taste wise, above average sweetness and full bodied with dark chocolate syrup, a heavy note of black licorice (maybe more than Ive ever tasted in a stout before), molasses, espresso faint bitterness and a little bit of alcohol burn that leads into espresso, sponge toffee, graham cracker, light fruit cake, and a massive dry espresso notes and dark chocolate finish with a little bit of bitterness. Yup. This definitely lives up to the hype, and then some. Its HUGE, but nothing about it seems too much. Wow. Im beyond impressed. Wow.

Gęste, czarne i oleiste. Trwała i równomierna piana. W aromacie mleczna czekolada, wanilia, tofi i kremowo. Wyraźne palone nuty.

Gęste, gładkie i treściwe. W smaku czekoladowo. Alkohol grzeje w przełyku

This is a top beer? Ok, good luck with that. My local beer-source had this so I thought Id try it out. Unfortunately its a very disappointing beer. It pours like it should, for a stout of high character, but it has utterly no diversity on the tongue that I can tell. Honestly I just wash through these and barely notice I had them. I recall being very disappointed on first sip that it wasnt actually the flavorful, nuanced beer I had paid 16+ change for but rather a watery, washed out stout that has all the characteristics of goodness but none of the depth. Looking for chocolate, vanilla bean, coffee? Not here. Not even peppers, I honesty cant taste anything in this beer. That this is a top 50 beer to me is hilarious, or maybe its because these people havent tasted Yeti stouts. I immediately thought this stout tries to do what Yeti does but fails. Reason Yetis been top of the heap for years, still best stout poured out of a regular bottle. 

The biggest disappointment, is again, the indecipherable taste, which one assumes was guessable when you realize theres no description of the flavor profile on the bottle wrapping. One of the more boring beers and for the price a complete waste. You all should get out to a pub and try more beers. Id take Dogfish head Breakfast Stout over this any day because at least you can taste something, even if its too sweet. Honestly I think they should take this expedition stout back to the lab because it didnt work, the party was lost.

12oz bottle. Dark black color with a brown head. Booze dark chocolate coffee malt aroma. Chocolate bitter coffee toffee flavour. Smooth heavy body. Very nice imperial stout. I expect it would be even better after some ageing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Expedition Stout has a thin, tan head, a very dark brown appearance, and minimal lacing. Aroma is strong and full- very dark brown bread crust, some alcohol, some chocolate powder, and cream. Taste is of those elements, with acrid bitterness from the char, with black cherry. Mouthfeel is full-on heavy & silky, and Expedition Stout finishes medium wet/dry and bold. RJT

Pitch black pour with a dense creamy khaki head. Oily lacing. Aroma is big chocolate, roast, coffee, and some berry in the background. Taste is milk and dark chocolate, bitter coffee, roasty, berry, and some toffee. Nice sweet and bitter balance. Thick body. Very nice stout.

Roasted, sweet, smooth, thick, molasses, vanilla, chocolate, licorice, highly drinkable. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. In overall wow, really good brew. Did not expect this for that price.
W aromacie kawa, czekolada, kakao, karmel. W smaku czekolada, kawa, popiół, kontrująca słodycz goryczka. Sporo ciała, niskie wysycenie. Dobre piwo, ale bez fajerwerków.

APARIENCIA: de color totalmente negro, no pasa luz a través de ella; corona de espuma color beige, cremosa y de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: muchas notas a café pero complejas, desde café tostado, torrefacción, granos de espresso, salsa de soya, cuero, caramelo, vainilla. Promete desde aquí.

SABOR: de entrada es dulce con predominio de esos sabores a café complejo, desde café tostado, torrefacto y granos de espresso, seguido de salsa de soya, cuero, algo de tabaco a lo que le da lugar a notas a chocolate amargo y semiamargo, caramelo, vainilla y ligeramente nueces; En el retrogusto queda un amargor medio ligero el cual es dulce con persistencia de notas a chocolate amargo, café y dulzor como vainilla.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio alto, untuosa y cremoso con baja carbonatación.

Bottle 33cl from Uba & Humal. Bottled 11/6/15. Pours black with a brown head. Roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla in the aroma. Rich, smooth roasted malts flavor with chocolate, vanilla. Excellent.

Uzupełnienie z notatek
Daktyle, troche figi i rodzynki, gorzka czekolada z duża zawartocią kakao, goryczki brak, taka cierpkosc od suszonych owocow na finiszu

Zwart bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: melkchocolade, wat hout en zoethout. Smaak: Kalisse! Drop, wat rood fruit, licht zoet, alcoholisch. Wat stroperig, plakkerig mondgevoel. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoete, fruitige drop met alcohol. Leuk, maar misschien wel wat kalisse overkill.
Aromat stricte likierowy. W smaku jest trochę likierowego alkoholu, trochę pralin. Przy tym bardzo gładkie i wytrawne z gorzką czekoladą. Bardzo smaczne.

W aromacie czekolada, praliny, kawa, wanilia, śliwki, bardzo przyjemnie. W wyglądzie czarne z obrączką beżowej piany. W smaku czekolada, praliny, kakao, mocna kawa, tort czekoladowy, wędzone śliwki, bardzo intensywne. Ciało gęste, aksamitne, piankowe, degustacyjne, bardzo konkretna palona goryczka. Ogólnie świetny ris o bardzo ładnym zapachu, złożonym i intensywnym smaku i mocnej goryczce nadającej charakteru.

Bottle at home (bottled 11/06/15). Pours dark with a small tan head. Light sweet aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, salty liquorice, dark fruits, light alcohol. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter, bitter roasted hoppy aftertaste. Soft carbonation, sticky and creamy mouthfeel. Very nice. Would love to drink this more often.
Another fantastic creation from Bells! Chocolate notes all throughout with a great malt backbone. Drinks with the complexity of a fine wine. Ages well and only gets better.
Daktyle, suszone figi, rodzynki, gorzka czekolada, słodkie, goryczka niska, lekko cierpkie na finiszu.
W aromacie figi, rodzynki. W smaku słodkie, rodzynki w czekoladzie. Po przełknięciu zostaje rodzynka oblepiająca usta, dobre ułożone brak alkoholu

Bottle 355ml (BB 11.06.2019). Completely black with beige, short head. Nice lacing. Aroma intense with bitter chocolate and cacao notes. There is also sweet note of noble alcohol behind. Roasty bitterness, quite high and agressive but it should be such in RIS. There is bitter chocolate and intense cacao in taste with nice, sweet liquor finish. Beer is full body, warms a bit inside and in the throat but anyway alcohol is well hidden. Even though beer is roasty, its also very smooth. Generally its very good RIS, chocalate and roasty.

Butelka z datą: 11/06/15
AROMAT: Bardzo intensywny. Pumpernikiel, rodzynki, marcepan, czekolada, paloność, nuty ziołowe (anyż), karmel.
SMAK: Z początku słodkawe karmelowo-czekoladowe. Potężna podbudowa słodowa. Posmak szlachetnej, mocno palonej kawy. Odczucie w ustach:gęste/oleiste niczym płynna czekolada. Alkohol idealnie wkomponowany w całość.
WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, bardzo niska, nieśmiało oblepia szkło.
OGÓLNIE: Świetnie ułożone piwo. Klasa, klasa, klasa! Jak widać na załączonym obrazku, Imperialnym Stoutom kilkutygodniowe podróże z USA do Europy nie wadzą, przeciwnie do piw mocno chmielonych dla których czas jest największym wrogiem. Choć odnoszę wrażenie, że Expedition Stout po prostu wyjechał już tak dobry już na etapie butelkowania. A gdyby tak była wersja leżakowana w beczce po bourbonie...STOP! Przecież jest Black Note Stout ;)
Opaque black, small expresso head. Expresso nose: lots of coffee and hint of licorice. Hoppy, foamy, coffeeish, chocolaty. Long licorice aftertaste. Really full-bodied.
Arôme plutôt faible. Pas de mousse. Gout de café prononcé et arrière goût fort amère pour un stout. Stout correct sans plus.
Lychee aroma. First is liquorish. Second is candy sugar and last is a light earthy note.

Bardzo klasyczny, nieco agresywny w odbiorze przykład risa. Czekolada, kawa, lekko szorstkie kakao i paloność. Szlachetne alkoholowe grzanie. Dobre, uczciwe piwo, bez udziwnień, choć biorąc pod uwagę skalę ocen - spodziewałem się nieco więcej.

Mélyfekete szín. Habja szinte nincs is. Nagyon testes, szinte krémes állagú. Étcsokoládés íz. Az alkohol alig van jelen, mintha egy kicsi kávélikőr lenne benne. Nagyon is ajánlott sör. Kategóriájának egyik legjobbja.
33 cl bottle from SB. Coffe , chocolate, dark fruit. Thick mouthfeel, bitter herbyspice stuff.

Riktigt svart öl. Mörk beige / brunt skum. Rostad malt, sötma, mörkt socker, torkad frukt, lite alkohol. Fantastiskt god!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours thick, black with a small brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla. Sweet and quite bitter. Full bodied, thick and smooth.
Bottle at DØE US tasting. Black with a dark brown head. Aroma medium+ malty (roasted) and hoppy. Flavor medium sweet, roasted, burnt, heavy bitter, light burning alcohol. Fat body, quite flat.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo - bottled 19 months ago. Black body with a thin tan head that slowly fades. Faint lacing. Aroma of furniture polish, charred barbecue and Christmas pudding. Flavour of espresso, dark chocolate and deep, roasted malts. Medium to full body with a smooth, creamy texture. The finish just goes on and on - for me it is the best thing about this wonderful beer.

Color negro con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación mínima. Aroma básicamente alcohólico, no capto más. Sabor torrefacto y alcohólico, demasiado fuerte para mi gusto.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Inky black, dark espresso head. Rich and luscious aroma - not as much roasty as sweet - molasses, dark fruit jam, alcohol spice. The taste is very intense, pretty heavy on malts, lots of molasses and sticky dark sugars, some dark fruits. Of course, the roast malts and the alcohol manage to turn it into a greater desert beer. Excellent.

Bottle, 355 ml, present by Vlado, shared with JFK10000. Pours black with small brown head. Roasted malts, lots of chocolate, coffee, cocoa, dark fruit. Quite sweet. Full bodied, soft carbonation, thick, creamy, oily. Great one.

Jet black with thin tan head that fades away swiftly. Aroma is dark chocolate, licorice, alcohol. Taste is initially aggressively bitter, then it evolves to mildly bitter after the beer sits in the glass for a while. Alcohol is maybe too predominant and not too well hidden by the malt base. Hints of coffee liquor and burnt bread. Undertones of smoked wood. Heavy body, viscous mouthfeel, low to medium carbonation. Bitter finish.

Piana niezbyt okazała, dość gruboziarnista, acz zaskakująco trwała. W aromacie sporo deserowej czekolady, ciemne owoce, strzelałbym w ciemne winogrona, kawa. W smaku na początku jest czekoladowo, gęsto, dalej sporo owoców, ale po chwili na łopatki rozkłada mnie mocarna goryczka, przysiągłbym, że o lekko chmielowym charakterze. Alkohol na finiszu jest odczuwalny, ale ładnie wpasowuje się w kompozycje. Posmak palony, bardzo gorzka czekolada i lekko kwaskowata kawa. Przez wysoką goryczkę, odczuwalna słodycz jest niezbyt wysoka, co nie przeszkadza jej sklejać ust podczas degustacji. Klasa RIS, dużo tu się dzieje. W życiu bym nie pomyślał, że po wypiciu tylu mocno chmielonych piw, z butów wyrzuci mnie goryczka imperialnego stoutu;)

Shared 12oz. bottle. Viscous pour, almost black with a tan head. Aroma of dark malt, chocolate. Taste: dark malt, chocolate, burnt undertones, hints of dark fruit, perhaps a touch of smoke, licorice notes, oak. Heavy body. Wow.

Bottle. BB 11-2015. Black oily pour. Aroma has chocolate, mocha coffee, mild licorice, red fruit and roasted caramelised malt. Taste has lucious caramelised malt, ripe fruit, smooth chocolate, soft licorice, coffee, molasses and a sweet bitter finish. Very balanced and very tasty. A classic worthy of its status.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of fig, prune, dark chocolate and roast malt. Moderate sweet with light bitterness. Full bodied, rich and creamy. Nice and boozy. Pretty damn good.
Bottle at the Lockview in Akron Ohio. Great Russian imperial Stout. Pours motor oil black.

Bottle. Pitch black with a slowly fading brown bubbly head. Aroma is of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, blackcurrant, nuts, biscuit, caramel, slightly smokey. Taste is of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted, bitter, caramel, dark fruits, biscuit, liquorice, balanced. Thick sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Aroma: chocolatey, malty, with slightly dank classic stout, slightly sweet; really nice; Appearance: pitch black with thin offwhite head that lingers; Taste: huge maltiness and booziness, but smooth and very drinkable; nice to have a pure stout without a lot of extra flavoring; Palate: heavy, creamy body with long, sweet finish thats balanced with bitterness; Overall: amazing. Might be my favorite imperial stout ever.

0,355 l bottle Pckd 11.06.15 from Mikkeller Julepakkekalender 
coffee, chocolate, roasty, black, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, full body, thick feel, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Schwarz mit geringer Schaumkrone. Reichlich malzig, Röstaromen, süßlich, dunkle Schokolade, Kakao, Espresso, etwas Vanille, leicht fruchtig, Beeren, Rosinen, leicht bitter.

Black pour with small tan head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, malts and hint of raisins. Taste is coffee, chocolate, unsweetened cocoa. Flavours balanced out nice as it warmed up.
Quite good beer, but not for TOP50

Reviewing one now, saving another for a year to see the changes.
1 finger mocha coloured head. 
Black as night. 
Aroma is dark chocolate, fudge, dates and some vinous tones. 
Taste is ... oh my god.. This is exactly what I want from a R.I.S.
As soon as it touches the tongue, flavours just begin to bombard the mouth. 
Huge chocolate tones, sweet dried fruits, a hint of cherry and a warming punch of alcohol. Obvious peanut taste at the very back which just makes this even better. As it warms up, a lot of vanilla becomes apparent at the back.
Thick, oily, perfectly balanced between carbonation and bitterness. 
Overall, this was just insane. Such classic taste notes but notched up to 100. 
Very close to a 10/10.
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is hoppy and and sweet raisin. Flavour is soft malty, chocolate, raisin sweet. Finish is slight bitter on top of the coffee note. Excellent.

butelka. czarne, bez refleksów, ciemnobrązowa piana, utrzymująca się w postaci drobnej obrączki do końca picia. w aromacie gorzka czekolada, kakao, szlachetny alkohol. po ogrzaniu śliwka, słody palone. w smaku na starcie słodkie, przechodzące w kwaśne by na finiszu długo utrzymywać się na podniebieniu w postaci popiołu, spalenizny. alkohol przyjemnie rozgrzewa, nasycenie właściwe dla stylu.
Poured deep dark brown, fudgy tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, smooth malt and cofffee. Flavour is quite similar, vanilla smoothness.Excellent Impy.
Dark, nearly no foam. Dark chocolate, molasses, roasted coffee. Well balanced between sweet and bitter side. Medium to full body, low carbonation, awesome finish.
Big beer, big smells and flavor. Dark fruit, liqorice, hints of dark chocolate. Slight warming.

Data butelkowania: 11.06.2015 r. Czarne, nieprzejrzysty. Piana skromna, beżowa, pozostaje jedynie obrączka na szkle. Aromat intensywny ciemnych słodów, gorzkiej czekolady, ciemnych owoców, orzechów. Smak po ogrzaniu zmienia się z pół słodkiego w kierunku pół wytrawnego. Dużo gorzkiej czekolady, winogron, orzechów. Konsystencja kremowa, lepka. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ułożony, extremalnie pijalne. Goryczka średnia, lekko zalegająca, lecz przyjemna. Wysycenie niskie. Spodziewałem się większej petardy jak na TOP50.

Noire dense, gros collet de tres fines bulles.
Aromes puissants de chocolat, café, caramel, vanille et liqueur.
Ronde et puissante, du cafe plein la bouche, une finale sur du marc de cafe et chocolat amere.
Humm comme cest bon

Bottle 355ml. Jet black with a deep brown head. Medium lacing. This pack onehelluva punch in the aroma. Coffee, chocolate, licorice, soy sauce. Taste adds raisin, and dark fruits while being somewhat not unpleasantly metallic. Palate is wonderfully smooth with perfect carbonation. Finish lasts forever. Great!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Draught at Barleys in Shawnee. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, dark fruit. Appearance is jet black with a minimal head. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, with a slight hint of vanilla. Mouthfeel was exceptionally creamy and luscious - more so than when I pour it from a bottle. Overall a killer imperial stout that continues to lead the pack of big imperial stouts.

341ml bottle from SF (thx, Matt!). Pours a very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate notes, some dark fruits notes and grassy notes. Taste is pretty the same with moderate sweetness. Very good stuff.

This has been on my shelf for about 8 years. So must date from about 2008. Well aged as suggested. I was considering this for rating number 5000 only 30 more away. But it called my name now and so here goes. Pours jet black with a tan head. The nose here is powerful, and is chocolate, coffee, dark ripe fruit and licorice. Very full in body with consistence of well used motor oil and a rich and creamy mouth feel with just a touch of the alcohol showing. The flavor is dark rich roasted matts with chocolate and coffee, the really dark ripe fruit and the licorice still is there. Very complex flavors and really balanced. The finish is chocolate bitter and very strong I do not know how much aging helped this beer but I am pretty sure it did not hurt it. So smooth, so tasty, and so enjoyable As good as it gets

Legendás ital, amire szinte sörös pályafutásom kezdete óta vártam, s a körülmények úgy alakultak az idők során, hogy különösebb erőfeszítés nélkül lehetővé vált a beszerzése. Alig billen meg kissé a koronazár, ki is szöknek nyomban a fekete aromák, amelyeknél intenzívebb illatokat érlelés nélkül valószínűleg lehetetlen elérni, benne van minden, ami egy erőteljes imperial stout esetében valaha is elvárható volt. Épphogy lefőtt kávé barnacukorral ízesítve, karamell, rumos-étcsokoládés szelet, konyakmeggy csemegeszerű jegyei, valódi aromakavalkád, sötét tónusú illatnyalábok parádéja. Íze hasonlóképpen méltóságteljes egyvelege a pörkölt malátás alapokra épülő kakaós, belga csokis, szirupos elemeknek, amelyek egy markáns, kesernyés, gyógynövényes komlós végkifejletben csúcsosodnak ki. Karaktere szinte kiált az érlelésért, egy pár év elteltével valószínűleg még ennél is simább, mélyebb lenne az egyébként is igen olvadékony, tökéletesen kerek, csordulásig telt szerkezet.

Pours black with medium head disappearing fast. Aroma: nice cocoa, dark dark chocolate, roastiness, a touch of licorice. Taste: dark chocolate, cocoa, roastiness. Palate is hoppy with a nice touch of sweetness and a pleasant touch of alcohol.

Black color with mocha head. Aroma is quite complex with coffee, chocolate, a bit of liquorice, even a slight dark fruit note. Taste starts with some dark, roasted malt acidity, coffee, chocolate and a hint of liquorice. Medium to heavy body with smooth mouthfeel. Overall its a really well made imperial stout, one of the best non barrel aged examples.

Black color with medium creamy brown head that fades in a while. Aroma of bitter chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, alcohol, cognac, dark fruits. Taste: the same as aroma, sweet with very nice depth. Creamy texture, full body, soft carbonation and a excellent bittersweet aftertaste. An absolute world class!

Jet black, oily texture. Lingering reddish head. Aroma cocoa, oak wood, espresso, cherries. Palate heavy, low carbonation. Taste sour cherries, cocoa powder. Red wine, oak wood and lasting biterness. Excellent.

Bottle, many thanks to MisoW. Pitch black colour with beige head. Very complex aroma, roasted, Cocoa, caramel, molasses, noble alcohol, bourbon. Taste is sweet, roasted, coffee, caramel, cocoa, alcohol, bourbon, molasses. Alcohol present. Very Good.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2016 Een favoriete stout. Zeer potent, maar zo uitgebalanceerd drink je ze bijna nooit. Bij ieder flesje ontdek je nieuwe dingen...

330ml bottle. Smell is amazing - rich vanilla and cacao with lots of fresh coffee scents. 

Pours thick and oily, black with some light brown head. 

Taste is coffee bitterness with some delicate sour hints I did not enjoy that much. 

Very oily and thick, that is the palate I like in my imperial stouts...

Overall those sour notes were the only thing that did not fit there in my opinion.
Wickedly complex and densely weaved. Very dry. Long bitter aftertaste. Potent. Still very tannic. Needs time.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Pyszne. Mega gładkie, gęste i zrównoważone - wanilia, czekolada, lukrecja, kawa, szlachetny alkohol, solidna paloność. Ogromna klasa, rewelacyjna cena.

Black. The big aroma and huge flavour feature roasted barley aplenty, liquorice, soy, hoppy spice, and chocolate. Highly sweet and bitter, yet balanced. Burnt and bitter finish, with a bit of alcohol. Full body, and a thick and silky smooth texture. Overall, a wonderful imperial stout. One of the best I have had. It is heavy, chewy, over the top, incredibly tasty, and yet, somehow balanced. Some sweet imperial stouts become cloying, but not this one.

Bottle. Breuvage noir avec une mousse brunâtre retombante. Café, chocolat, noisette, fruits confits apparaissent au nez. Lentrée en bouche est une fanfare mais la première impression va vers une douceur et un moelleux extraordinaires : des saveurs emplissent la bouche et on goûte quelque chose de subtil fait de café, dalcool, de chocolat, de fruits noirs ... et en finale une douce amertume qui duuure. Douceur et plénitude.

(Bottle) Black body with a small, diminishing tan head. Aroma of molasses, cacao, a little sour, some dark fruit. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, flat carbonation. Flavor has chocolate, dark fruit, mildly sour, coffee, wood, strong bitter roasted notes.

Pours thick as hell and smells like a bunch of strong coffee with chocolate, caramel, & roasted malts following behind. Tastes is similar with an arrival full of dark coffee (Italian roasts/espresso); extra dark chocolates in middle; finishes with a lot of caramel and a bit of alcohol once the beer warms up. Theres of course a healthy amount of roasted malts all throughout. Full-bodied and chewy texture with very low carbonation. Sticky on the lips but dried-out ending. Its simply one of the best beers in the style and serves as a benchmark for me. (Its not expensive either, so thats incredible!)

Aroma: vanilla, sugar, spy sauce, roasty
Taste: medium sweet, roasty, vanilla, brown sugar, xhocolate

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel, charred oak, smoke, dark and dried fruits. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel, charred oak, smoke and dried fruits. The aftertaste is long and bitter. The alcohol is very present, especially on the tongue. The mouthfeel is thick and smooth. A nice beer!

Definitely deserves its reputation. So smooth and creamy, with hints of vanilla, burnt caramel and big coffee and chocolate flavours. Quite Bitter throughout, will definitely age the other bottle, as I believe this beast will only get better.

Dark brown almost black colour with thick creamy off brown head. Full body and low carbonation. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malt, burned caramel and coffee. Chocolate and roasted malt flavor with some sweet notes of caramel and bread. A russian imperial stout that everyone has to taste!
Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Intense roasted and chocolate coffee aroma. Big chocolate and sweet caramell taste with a full body beer. Intense and balanced bitterness. Lasting roasted finnish.
Bottle 2015 vintage. Taste of dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice, salt, black pepper and brown sugar. Very nice oily texture and smooth mouthfeel. Still pretty bitter ending.
Robusta y con notas presentes de la malta tostada, chocolate y un poquillo de vainilla. Casi no se sienten los 10.5 grados de alcohol. Muy compleja para no estar añejada en barricas de algún tipo.

Barwa nieprzejrzyście czarna, piana kiepska, powstaje z trudnością, redukuje się do obrączki.
Aromat bardzo przyjemny i soczyście słodki. Suszone owoce i nuty porto, deserowa czekolada, a w tle delikatny sos sojowy z ulotna nutą alkoholu. 
W smaku piwo jest gęste i bardzo pełne. Wraz z pierwszym łykiem słodycz przyjemnie rozlewa się po ustach. Dominuje smak kawy i gorzkiej, gęstej czekolady. W tle pojawiają się suszone czerowne owoce w alkoholu. Goryczka średnio-wysoka, kakaowa, z nutami tytoniowymi, fajnie kontruje stronę słodową. Alkohol lekko podszczypuje i rozgrzewa gardło.
kawowo gorzko czekoladowo, trochę też cukierków pralinek, dosyc geste, dlugi posmak, dobry klasyk

Aroma is sweet and malty with a roasty cloak that brings expectations to the max. Full of chocolate notes but also a hint of red berries. Taste is full on top notch Imp Stout-ish. Big sweet caramel notes, smooth mocha and fudge. Thick creamy molasses and dried fruits. This is truly an excellent stout
Flarra! Doft av hav o tång. Smak av kaffe o läder med en mycket lång o go eftersmak. En riktig njutaröl som blir bättre o bättre ju längre du har den i glaset.

Black colour, small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruits, coffee, bacon, hops. Dry sweet taste with bitter hoppy finish and dry roasty aftertaste. Full body and soft carbonation. Rich and complex stout, very enjoyable.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget, vintage 2015. Pitch black with a long lasting brown head, rich sticky lacing on the glass. Roasted malty aroma, some sweet notes of dried fruit but mostly roasted coffee and chocolate notes, licorice and soy sauce, a hint of forest mushrooms. Full-bodied, soft, carbonated, silky and chalky mouthfeel. Roasted malty taste chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla, plum, sweet molasses and milk chocolate are included. Roasted cocoa chalky finish.
Kolsvart med ett skum av små bruna bubblor. Doft: Kakao, rostat, pralin, lakrits, rågbröd, sött kaffe, kola, Snickers. Smak: Som doft + smörkola, honungsmelon. Underbar.

Piana beżowa, drobna, całkiem ładna. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta, z brązowym nieśmiałym refleksem. Trunek intensywnie pachnie ciemnym kakao, pralinami, truflami, kawą espresso, lodami czekoladowymi... W smaku przyjemnie gładkie, oleiste, pełne... Poza powtórką tego, co w aromacie, jest fajna słodycz, likierowość, popiołowość, a wszystko skontrowane wysoką, palono tytoniową goryczką. Wysycenie drobne, niskie, ale delikatnie poszczypujące na języku. Alkohol rozgrzewający, ale kojarzący się raczej z jakimś drogim destylatem, koniakiem...

Przyznaję, że piwo idealnie trafia w mój gust - gęste, słodkie, intensywne i ładnie skontrowane paloną goryczką. Gdyby dodać jeszcze burbonowej wanilii to byłby top topów!

12 oz bottle. Pours a thick black with full dark tan head. Aromas of condensed dark fruit, sweet dark chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malts. Flavors of rich nutty chocolate, dry roasted malts, dry black coffee and a hint of chicory. Dry and dusty. Great stuff.

Svart och fin. En väldigt tydlig, ren och balanserad Stout. Smakerna sitter där de ska, mycket god.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: burnt malt, fruits and alcohol ether, coffee, dark chocolate, prunes. 
Appearance: dark, with small brown head.
Taste: full-bodied, complex taste, with alcohol and a pleasant bitterness. Dry finish.
Palate: full body, viscous, nice soft warmer, light carbonation.

Black oil with a fine beige head. Ok lacing. Decent intensity in the aroma. Full body and a soft carbonation. Oily texture. Nice mellow sweetness. Not cloying in any way. Well masked alcohol. Coffee, some roast, chocolate, toffee and some dried fruits in the flavor.[Bottle from a trade with Nisse666]

Bottle @ home. Aroma of roasted malts, vinous booze, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate. Black with tan head, not lasting. Taste is light+ sweet, alcohol sweetness and moderate malt bitter. Full body, oily thick feel, roasted vinous feel.
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Pours black with thin khaki head. Lots of malt, chocolate, roast, molasses and some fruit. definitely sweet in a good way. Very complex.

Dang! Thats tasty. Its like opening a bar of dark chocolate mixed with rich toasted (almost burnt) grain. Taste is strong, bold and deliciously chocolate, malt, toffee, raisins. Pours like spent motor oil--nice work. Finish is not too sticky and has a nice bitter punch. Age this for when the zombie come...

355ml bottle. Pours an oily black colour with a brown creamy foam head which leaves some lacing. Nose of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, booze. Flavour is roast, malty, molasses, rich chocolate & coffee, dark fruits, some hops, and earthy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, full bodied, soft carbonation, dry roasted bitter finish. Nicely balanced, very drinkable.

0,355l bottle from 100pív, Bratislava, Pours dark black liquid, minimal dense creamy brown head, Aroma: coffee, espresso, milk, sweet, coffee liquor, dark chocolate, Christmas sweets, spicy, rich malty, cake dough, Taste: heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sour, dark chocolate, espresso liquor, spicy, caramel, red candied fruits, Palate: full body, soft carbonation, creamy to oily mouthfeel, long chocolate esspresso liquor aftertaste, Overall: exccelent brew, enjoyed.

Botella 33 cl en el Lupulo 28..08..2016. Lote 15025 PKGD 11..06..2015 (embotellada). Color negro intenso con poca espuma beige oscuro. Aromas y sabores intensos maltosos costados con buenas dosis de cacaos vainilla ligeras lactosas y muy suave amargo final. cuerpo medio a intenso fino algo líquido y cremoso al final pero fácil de beber. para repetir sin duda.

Aroma of licorice, leather, chocolate, burned sugar, raisins plum. Taste is very complex, plum, licorice, chocolate, with a solid roasted coffee chocolate and herbaceous bitterness. To me one of the very best "clean" Imperial Stouts with Ten Fidy.

Bottle. Pours jet black, beige head with slight lacings. Aroma is big, molasses, roasted malt, leather, coffee, vanilla, tree. Well, the whole package really. Taste is creamy with big roastes malty notes, strong coffee, vanilla, finishes roasted, bitter and hides the alcohol well, red berries in the very end. Big body, medium carbo. Well, a real mouthful.
B-. Pours a black color with khaki head. In usually not big on stouts, but this one aint bad
Amazing. Big nose. Big body. Vanilla, medium roasted coffee, white chocolate, marshmallows, earthy hops... huge finish, wow !!!
33 cl från systembolaget. En grym Stout. Fanns vissa likheter med popcorn! Coolt.
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2016 Donkerzwart met dikke cremekleurige schuimkraag die langzaamaan wegebt. Koffie, gebrande mout, chocolade met een lekkere bittere afdronk. Blijft goed plakken. Prima volle stout.

A great impy stout, the aroma is full of coffee and chocolate spice. Amazingly well balanced flavour, with some chocolate cream, some coffee bitterness, and a fruit spice finish. Wish I bought some more bottles , I imagine this will be amazing in 5 years!
Bottle from SB. Black with a brown head. Aromas of coffee, liquorice, fudge, soy, chocolate and some dried fruit. Tasting notes are pretty much the same with a little smokey touch.

Aromat... Praktycznie nie używam tego deskryptora, ale ciśnie się sam mózg. Pumpernikiel. Jest paloność, zboże, toffee, czekolada. Fajny. Smak lekko gorzki i lekko słodki. W sumie z piciem goryczka narasta. W smaku duża paloność, pumpernikiel, popiół, mocno palona kawa, wytrawne kakao. Posmak długi, wytrawny, kawowo i pestkowo gorzki, w tle nuta alkoholu. Ciało średnie do pełnego, faktura oleista i wysycenie poniżej średniej. Nie jest to mój styl stouta, trochę zbyt gorzki i wytrawny, goryczka na finiszu jak w solidnym ipa. Ogólnie smaczny ale bez rewelacji.

355ml bottle, 2015 vintage. Black with one finger brown head. Aroma is sweet with chocolate, coffee, dark malts, light roasted tones and rich dark fruits. Taste has a nice initial bitterness with roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate giving way to rich dark malts and some dark fruits and ending again on a bitter roasted note. Filling, slightly chevy, mouthfeel, low carbonation and bitter roasted aftertaste with some very high cocoa chocolate notes and noticeable alcohol warmth.

2015 vintage. 3 finger tan head, black body. Nose: Figs, dates, coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, resin, soy-sauce, espresso, milk-chocolate and a hint of alcohol. Taste: Licorice, dark bitter chocolate, cacao, coffee, dates, raisins, resin, grapefruit, roasted malts, soy-sauce, milk-chocolate and espresso. 
Long, very bitter ending. Wow!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, prezent, warka z 11/06/15. Wyglad jak wyglad, piwa zazwyczaj sa ladne. zwlaszcza jak nalac do rantu, wiec nie nalalem do rantu. Aromaty bardzo intensywne i fajnie zlozone, jak dla mnie najwiecej tu pumpernikla, kawy, czekolady, alkoholu, ale sa tez jakies ciemne owoce (sliwki suszone), jakies pralinki czy insze cholerstwo z bombonierki, nieco palonosci, popiolu... zeby nie to, ze sie nie znam, to bym pewnie znalazl jeszcze 23 inne nutki. Sprawia w aromacie slodkie wrazenie. W ustach niby tez slodkie, ale z przerwa na wytrawno goryczkowe klimaty (ta goryczka to solidna jest, ryli), by przejsc w dlugi znow wytrawny i ciut nawet kwaskowaty posmak kawowy... fajny efekt. Nie ma wrazenia jakiegos wielkiego ciala, ale jest dosc syropowe i lepiace usta - wystarczajaco by nie marudzic, za malo by sie podniecac. alko zamaskowane... yyy... prowizorycznie ;) ale zamaskowane. Chyba nie sciemniaja, ze do lezakowania przeznaczony, zeby kazdy sobie palete mogl pod siebie dobrac - normalnie jak na Komesie :) ewidentnie bardzo bardzo fajny, klasa, niemalo sie w nim dzieje, ale tez ewidentnie mozna znalezc takie bardziej pod moj przeslodzony gust i pod delikutasne podniebienie :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Chocolate, coffee, roastiness, vanilla in nose. pours jet black with beautiful tan lacy foam. Taste is medium sweet with lots of chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla, ash. Medium bitter finish, full body, oily mouthfeel. Overall amazing stuff, really delicious.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark colour beer with a small beige head. Roasted malts with coffee and chocolate some notes of licorice. Dry finish.

Flaska systembolaget. Svart vätska med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av kakdeg, torkad frukt, mörk choklad och farinsocker. Söt och rostad smak. Choklad, vanilj och lite kaffe. Krämig munkänsla med bitter avslutning. Djup och fyllig svans.

I det närmaste svart med ljusbrunt skum. Kaffe och mörk choklad i doften plus lite sötare ljus choklad. Mycket fyllig och rund i mun. Mörk choklad, kaffe och aningen tamarind, en liten fin beska på slutet. En mycket angenäm imperial stout.

Good aromas of coffee, chocolate and licorice. Luscious flavor of coffee, chocolate, licorice, soy and some sweetness. Good bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Towards the end it becomes dry but still good. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Flaska från SB. Svart med lite beige skum. Doft av choklad och torkad frukt. Lite spritig i smaken men ändå rund och fin. Choklad, kola och russin i smaken.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours black with thick beige head. Coffee aroma with coffee and cocoa taste. Rich and creamy with some liquorice and cocoa after taste.
Flarra rest Krokiusgatan . Medel till fyllig imperial Stout. Omedelbart mycket kaffe . Ganska torr med bitter choklad och en tydlig syra. Lång fin eftersmak. Medelhårt kolsyra. Fiin

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours pitch black with creamy, khaki head. Aroma of liquorice, wood, coffee and dried fruit. Taste of dark, bitter chocolate, liquorice, leather, ash and slight coffee. Dry and quite bitter. Big and bold but a little bit too bitter for me to give out higher scores.

(Bells Expedition Stout) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a snifter, vintage 2013. ABV 10.5%
Pitch black colour on the body, tall and thick dark beige head with average retention.
Aroma is heavy on the roasted malts, alcohol, light vanilla, some coffee notes on the background.
Nice taste, more coffee now and chocolate too, vanilla, notable alcohol, roasted malts, coal, mocca.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, very sticky on the palate.
Very good.

355ml bottle.
Pours pitch black, with a thick brown head.
Massive, roasted aroma, layers of chocolate, coffee, licorice, chestnut, tobacco, ashes, caramel, dark fruit, hops.
Semi-sweet, full bodied (and beyond), high but balanced bitterness, creamy CO2.
Complex taste, everything from the aroma is reflected, rich, silky smooth, chocolate, licorice, tobacco, caramel, hops.
Long, rich finish, lingering bitterness, very well balanced. Impressive. (2016-09-10)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ Agards väg 10/9-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Roasted malty with dark chocolate and coffee, also sweet with notes of dried fruits. Body is full, the finish is bitter and roasted with dark chocolate and coffee.

Bottle 0,33l at Akkurat Pub, Stockholm. Pours a deep dark brown color with a large brown head. Aroma is bold and lightly boozy with notes of alcohol, dark chocolate, raisins, licorice, vanilla, rum. Taste is medium sweet with dark chocolate, dried fruits, raisins, licorice, light soy sauce and burning alcohol. Full bodied with good carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a small mocha head. Nose: strong aroma of roasted malt, coffe, sweet chocolate, brown sugar, soy, dried fruits, light fruity hopiness.Taste: bittersweet chocolate, biscuits, brown sugar, coffee, resin and alcohol. Mouth: full body, with a oily texture. Soft carbonation. "It is a little rough in the aftertaste at the moment (alcohol and roasted bitter), but I think some years will make it absolutely perfect."

$14.99 / 6. Bottled on 8/22/14. Re-rated after aging 2 years. The aging has worked wonders. Pours thick with no head at first. Slight carbonation bubbles up a thin dark brown ring that persists through drinking the entire glass. Inky black viscous appearance. No light gets through this one. Intense roast and chocolate flavors. Slight bitter finish but not overpowering. Aging has mellowed out the harsher flavors of the fresh bottle. Some sweetness gone but slightly sweet. Truly world class stuff. Im amazed that this stuff is always sitting on the shelf after the season ends. Dont know what people are thinking.

Pitch black color, small brown head. Chocolate aromas, roasted malt, raisins, soy, dates, slight tart. Taste is the very essence of imperial stout. A sweet chocolate and raisin taste perfectly balanced by the bitter roasted and soy flavors, like taking a big bite out of a dark chocolate bar. Complex and straight forward at the same time. Slight alcoholic during the finish. In short - I like it.

Bottle @ home. Pours a pitch blå k liquid with a beige to brown head. Aroma is sweet and roasted with intense notes of dark chocolate, espresso, dark fruits, vanilla and licorice. Big mouth feel and a smooth yet sharply rosted taste. Flavors of chocolate, vanilla, licorice, Ash, raisins. Nice coffee bitterness.

Almost black beer with a two finger high, beige-brown head. Lacing clings on the glass. 

This sure looks delicious! 

Nose: Mocha, sweet roasted malt, molasses, brown sugar, dark syrup, coffee, dark but sweet chocolate, vanilla, dried fruit and leather. 
Taste: Ohhh... Smooth, sweet, dark taste of coffee, chocolate, licorice, mocha, molasses, vanilla, grain and fudge. 
Mouth: Full, absolute full mout! Thick and creamy, oily texture. Smooth. Sweet and dry ending. 

So beautiful! 
Im in love :)
Bottle at home. Pours a pitch black colour. Wonderful chocolate aroma. Rich with notes of dark chocolate, vanilla, liquorice and dark fruits. Very flavourful. Top notch.

33 cl bottle, poured in snifter. Finally. Pours black and dense like petrol, extremely thin and dark brown head. Smells huge, already potent from 30 cm: vanilla, dark fruity, meringue, milk chocolate, complex barrel notes, with bourbon and rum. Tastes lots of cocoa and dark chocolate, very malty character, caramel, some bourbon again, espresso and woody notes coming through towards the end. Medium plus sweetness, which has a lovely initial bite followed by a medium to high roasted bitterness. Full bodied, creamy and oily, soft but present carbonation, long finish. Extremely tasty and smelly, balanced and so well blended, mellow but never cloying with just the right amount of bitterness, with all the barrel and spirit complexity added. This is Speedway Stout and few others Imp. Stouts "goodness" level, a world class RIS that kept all the great expectations I had.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Pours pitch black with a minimum brown head. Great malt and coffee aroma. Well balanced taste, rather sweet with caramel at start, ending with a strong roasted coffee biterness. Really nice stout, wonder how a barrel aged version would taste like...humm!

Bottle: Black colour, big brown creamy head. Aroma of vanilla, wood, dark choclate, candy, caramelly, coffe, and nice complex aroma. Flavor had a smooth nice mix og coffe, dark choclate, coffe, nice dry bitter nes in the end. Medium to full body, long finish!

Nice deep dark brown with brown head. Aroma is sweet and toasty and has a sharpness to it. The alcohol is present in the aroma as well. The brew is very full bodied and the taste is moderately sweet and smooth up front and quite bitter in the finish. Lots of grinded coffee bean taste in the finish. Good tasting but not among the most complex of its kind I think.

Bottle (bottled on 11/06/15). Pours a dark body with a medium tall tan head. Aroma has hoppy/tarry notes of dark chocolate and dark malts. Thick mouthfeel. Sweet and roasty taste with dark cocoa and licorice, finish is hoppy and warming. It reminds me of Founders Imperial Stout but the level of complexity is not quite up there - it feels like this one has less layers and the hopping is more robust. Also, the alcohol presence is a touch more visible (although they are both 10,5 %). It only lacks the "wow" factor of its fellow Michigander. Other than that, its still a solid textbook example of a classic Imperial Stout.

Bottle. Black, creamy foam. Great aroma: coffee, chocolate, port wine, brandy. Taste: burnt barley and coffee, brandy, chocolate, port wine, caramel, prunes, dried fruits, cakes, hop bitterness. Great one.
Tastes of vanilla and coffee. Treacle like oiliness on the palate. Tasted at Gents Bier Festival 2016

Shared by Maakun at Maakun back from US tasting. Black with light tan head. Sweet roasted chocolate malts. Molasses, chocolate, sugar cane, heavy roasted note, almost coffee like. Toffee. Big sweet, medium bitter. Full body, sticky heavy slick body. Soft carbonation. Nice.

Bottle shared. Black with small beige head. Lots of dark chocolate, oats, molasses, some bitter coffee, dried leaves, lots of roasted notes with some licorice. Medium sweet and bitter. Full bodied with creamy feel. Great classic imperial stout, nicely balanced.

What a beer! 9 months old. Aroma of rich roasted malt, tons of dark fruit, coffee, and sweet chocolate. Incredible smooth taste of heavily roasted malt, sweet chocolate, brown sugar, and coffee. Mild coffee like bitterness. Huge thick coating mouthfeel. The taste lingers on the palate. Alcohol only present slightly with warming in the chest. World class. Typically I don't like RIS's but this one is incredible. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing beer that ages well. This was a 2 year old bottle. Very smooth with great chocolate flavors. Full of rich stout characteristics without being overly heavy.

Bottle @ The Bishops Arms Marina, Helsingborg 20160815. Roasted malty and sweet with coffee and chocolate, dried fruits, full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter, sweet and roasted with coffee.
Flaska från Mikkeller Webbshop. Smak och doft av kaffe, choklad, vanilj, rostade toner, lakrits och karamell. Fin sötma, rund och len, bra balans mellan aromerna som avslutas med en fin beska.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 From bottle, pour is dark syrupy thick and black in color. Sitting atop the beer the head is chocolate brown. The aroma is initially alcohol and dark chocolate there are further notes of coffee and a bright herb. The taste is alcohol initially followed by a milk chocolate taste and sweetness, then bitter dark chocolate and coffee. The body of the beer is very smooth with a medium to thick mouthfeel. Overall this beer is a very good stout has a strong alcohol body with very good coffee and chocolate flavors throughout the beer.

Bottle. Pours a rich, thick, motor-oil black with a high, fine-grained, creamy medium brown head; there is no light getting through that baby at ALL. Nose is amazing; coffee; black cherry, baking chocolate, pipe tobacco, port wine, cinnamon, brown sugar, and pumpernickel. Wow. On the tongue -- that is one of the smoothest, most elegant RIS I have ever had. Perfectly integrated, sweet without being cloying, velvety and rich, with a long, drier, smoky coffee finish. Damn near perfect.

Bottle. Black. Malty dark roasty, kinda dry roasty, some soy in the background, intense nose. Full bodied, dry woody heavy malty, english portery character. Long lingering motoroily finish, intense. Really nice clean, traditional ris. Tasty, sippery.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Yes it pours out black & seeming thicker than beer should be. The aroma not so scary, subdued . i smell black olivesis it just the color, a hint of vinegar/soureverything else is sort ofcoffee, alcohol hidden, a friendly version molasses. With flavor the roast malt and alcohol come to the forefront, dry molasses, a little sawdust. Smooth & thick.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Bottle at home, bottled 11.06.15. Pours pitch black and thick, topped by a firm brown, creamy head. Rich espresso and dark chocolate notes, molasses, butterscotch, red fruits, really boozy, rounded but bitter finish with ash, leather. Big roasted malty aftertaste, quite bitter. Big body, medium carbonation, velvety soft mouthfeel. Tat too bitter and boozy for my liking, but a very well executed stout.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 Bkack tight beige head aroma of coffee slight smokeyness taste piney like a bipa but doesnt open up like one espresso coffee you cant miss the alcohol. May improve with age but i did well leaving it in the cupboard for 6 weeks dont go in for all that aging malarkey

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 27/07/2016 Bottled: 11-06-2015.
Color negro espuma beige, sabor cafe, chocolate, cuerpo alto, sedosa.

Bottle from Csakajosör. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, dark fruits, licorice, chocolate, nuts, a bit of hops and oak. Bitter finish with roasted malts, dark fruits, oak, chocolate, licorice, dark fruits and a bit of nuts. Exquisite imperial stout.
Bottle and draught. Dark colour, chocolate and roasted malts in aroma, bitter chocolate in the taste

Aromas a chocolate, fruta madura, pasas y ciruelas
Un aspecto magnífico poca espuma pero persistente
En boca completa y compleja 
Mucho cuerpo chocolate y café y muy maltosa con fruta madura

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Rich roasted malt aroma with notes of chocolate, dark fruit and a bit of coffee. Pours black with a thin light brown head with good retention and excellent lacing. Starts with rich roasted malt flavors as well as sweet dark fruit notes to go with a rich full body and mouthfeel. Finishes incredibly smooth with chocolate and just a hint of coffee. Top notch and an excellent stout.

Black colour, mocca head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roasted malts. Taste is light to medim sweet, light to medium bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Rating 1111.

Appearance: black, clear, brown foam, rocky head, lasts well. Aroma: roasty, bread, cocoa, sour. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, really nice balance. Roastiness appears in taste. Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, light astringent, long bitter aftertaste.

Bottle from beer gonzo. Hard to come by this beer in the UK. Just a casual top 50 beer of a Tuesday evening. A creamy viscous opaque black coloured pour with a lasting dark tan head. Aroma is nicely layered earthy roasted malts, Hickory smoked wood, toasted coconut shaving, treacle and some tangy berry fruits in there as well. Palate is full bodied and creamy, velvety smooth, maybe a little on the sweet side. Moderate carbonation stops it from being overtly cloying. Flavour is composed rich dark chocolate, roasted grains, treacle and bitter liquorice. Rounded sweet finish with some acrid roasted notes. Very enjoyable.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A sparkling black beer with a big brown creamy head ; good retention and lacing. Roast, coffee, black chocolate, light herb, toasty note. Medium sweet, medium to heavy dry bitter warming. Full body, elegant, light creamy texture, soft carbonation, dry bitter lasting coffee finish. Overall, awesome beer !! Great story and body. A delicious dessert.
Bottle. Dark in color with an offwhitw head. Chocolate and dark fruityness in aroma. Dark chocolate and some coffee in taste. Smooth.

Bottle from Uba ja Humal. Bottled 06.11.2015 (i.e 8 months ago). Pours near black with a tan head that aint big but retains around the edge. Aroma of chocolate fudge cake with rum, vanilla and figs, raisins... Thick... Tastes oh so sweet, liquid chocolate fudge cake, hint of tobacco. Heavy on the tongue, very fine but somewhat active carbonation, considerable tobacco / black tea bitterish finish. Even slightly burning hoppiness. Oh man. I wonder what its like after aging... Would love to know... Lovely stuff, pretty much exactly the way I like my Impies.

Bottle in wine glass. I wasnt expecting this beer to be so good. Pours beautifully in black leaving a perfect brownish 2 mm head. Aroma is full of coffee and roasted caramel that both comes forth in great complexity on the palate. Long evolving finish that is really world class. Glad to see it has the proper score here on RB.

The aroma is nice and toasty but I definitely get a bit of cardboard in there too. When it comes to flavor though, this is bomb. Deep molasses, coffee and chocolate, a light smoky roast. Wonderful finish on it. Long and robust.

0,355l bottle at home. PKGD (packaged?) 11/06/2015. almost black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells roasty, light alcohol, coffee, light wood, lightly glueish, some sherry, earthy, also coffee, hints of dried fruits. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes roasty, light licorice, light alcohol, a bit glueish, some dried fruits, raisins. finishes light roasty with notes of raisins and some alcohol. not bad but also not that spectacular. had this at the same time with dark horse plead the 5th, and that one wins by a margin.. overall still very nice beer though.

12 oz. bottle from Brix, west Omaha location. Consumed while watching the boys blow off fireworks on the 4th. Pour is black, huge foamy tan/brown head. Aroma is coffee, a sweet smoke, dark chocolates, sweet bourbon, sycamore wood. Taste is ashy, smoky, bitter chocolate, bourbon barrel, alcohol is apparent, but not overly aggressive.
Bottle.Black with a medium head that took time to dissipate. Full bodied with traces of liquorice and pretty malty. A good beer in a very obvious way.

355ml bottle from Beer Gonzo. Pours black, good receding tan head. Aroma is smooth caramel chocolate, jammy fruit. Taste is smooth, seductive cocoa, caramel, roast and coffee with some tobacco on the finish. Pretty awesome.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Almost black. Tan head. Lacing present. Aroma of roast, coffee, brown bread, brandy. Medium to full body. Creamy texture. The flavour a combination of coffee, roast, brandy. Light bitterness. Oh its so good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

0.355l bottle. Pitch black body, thin brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, caramel, figs, raisins and cocoa. Taste of chocolate, coffee, plums, raisins and a decent amount of floral hops. Medium to full body, creamy texture. Very nice.
Black liquid with beige head. Aroma of chocolate, raisins, rye. Taste of chocolate, rye, vanilla. Full body, astringent, average carb, long fin.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Chocolate, vanilla, caramel, coffee aromas. Taste is dark chocolate, liquorice, smokey, smooth long lasting finish. Nice.

How: bottle Appearance: very dark brown with a red shimmer, small creamy brown head. Aroma: blackberries, wood, burnt caramel, red wine, liquorice, anis, some herbal tones. palate: full body, soft carbonation.

From Labirratorium. In Teku glass. Warching Silicon Valley 2x03-05. Great asphalt rafts to celebrate my 1000 different beers. Amazing aroma and great taste. Great example of the style. Take care of its ABV
355ml Bottle - Black in colour. Plain chocolate, treacle and liquorice in the aroma. Rich and roasted taste with notes of plain chocolate, roasted malt, coffee and liquorice.

Bottle.
Dark brown color, oily texture. Rich aroma: caramel, toffee, liquoir, coffee. Taste: warming alcohol, sweet, also bitter, roasted, toffee. Full body. Very good.

Fair sized sampel from 355 ml. bottle at Gollem. Bottle says 11/06/2015 meaning bottled 6th of November 2015 I assume? Black, solid mocha. Nose is mellow umami, herbal with roast, soy sauce, taste is mellow herbal umami, some soy sauce, low molasses, roast, touch of blueberry, very long aftertaste which is nice but finish is largely thinner umami, herbal, roast, almost vegetable, some earth in the finish. Thinner than expected syrup & molasses body. Kind of expected a bit more from a beer this big in production & massive in appreciation. Price & distribution probably play a bit roast but this huge umami, burned mushroom & vegetable profile didnt do it for me. I prefer my RIS with more desert-like coffee & chocolate sweetness. This one was a bit lost on me, I actually started liking it less as it warmed up. I heard that this beer needs a lot of time but I just dont see this flavours evolving closer to what I like.

Bottle. Black body with small tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with caramel and coffee there are also dried red fruits. Taste is coffee roasted malts cocoa some vanilla and alcohol. Aftertaste is roasted malts bitterness with some vanilla sweetness. Nice one

12 fl oz bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 17-06-2016.
Bottled: 11-06-2015.
In short: really nice IStout.
Pours black with nice tan head.Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, dark licorice, creamy, some coffee nose. Full body, soft carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is roasty, moderate bitter, coffee, some creamy notes, sweet and warm aftertaste. Really good.

Almost blackish beer with beige head on top. Aroma has slight liquor, some berries, roasted malts, espresso coffee, some berry note and liquor-like ending, a bit boozy after warming up. Full body and lowish carbonation. A slight disappointment, maybe the voyage from USA to Finland has taken its toll.

Pitch black colored, medium tan creamy head, good lasting. Aroma is of caramel and chocolate, some brown sugar, bit dark fruit, coffee, roasted malt, bit boozy. Taste is medium to very sweet caramel and dark chocolate, some brown sugar, bit dark fruits, roasted malt and coffee, roasted coffee medium+ bitterness, dry roasty finish, some alcohol with warming. Full- bodied, soft- carbonation, creamy. Very fine! Other bottle will be aged for a while...
(bottle, Vrutak, Zagreb)

Pitch black oil thick viscosity color with a very thin beige foam ring. The nose has sweet chocolate and some decent berry touch and some hints of alcohol. The taste is extremely thick, smooth and full. The taste has an intense detonation of chocolate, vanilla, berries and a slight spicy alcoholic finish. Dry chocolate light alcoholic smooth milky aftertaste.

Bottle. Cotteridge, Brum. Not far off black. Film of sticky, tan head. Nose has savoury, roast malts. Some bonfire toffee. Some herbal, grassy hop. Some under ripe berry fruit. Taste is thick, chewy, charcoal sweet. Big, fruity, roast malt bitterness. Lots of bitter tang. Mouthfeel is smooth and fairly bright, given the ABV. Fruity, tangy, roast coffee and chocolate bitter finish. Decent.

33cl bottle via Beer Gonzo. It pours a deep dark brown color with a large brown head. Aroma is bold and lightly boozy with notes of dark chocolate, raisins, licorice, vanilla, rum. Taste is also medium sweet and bold, with a light warming booze finish. More notes of dark chocolate, dried fruits, raisins, licorice, light soy sauce. Full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, bold and tasty

Bottle courtesy of Douglas from Portland-USA. BB 2015. Shared in Rome-Italy. Thank you! Black pour, still a brownish lacing. Great. Nose: Cocoa, a bit oxidation, sweet vanilla, just great! Mouth: still a bit frizzy, chocolate and a mild chicory a bit herbal. Great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled shared by ippopotamo36 (thanks Alberto!). Vintage 2012. Pours deep brown with a minimal head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, licorice, oxidation, olive. Flavour of chocolate, coffee, licorice, bitter in the end. Medium to high body, light carbonation. Oxidated, but still great!
355 ml bottle from Mikkeller Beer Club. Black with tanned head. Roasted malt, coffee, bitter chocolate. Thick, semi dry with medium bitterness and low carbonation. Rock solid.
Apearance dark brown in glass allmoust black. Nice whoam what stays. Aroma is like sirens with coffe and chocolate. Taste is bound up bitter, chocolate and sweet.
Black with creamy head. Amazing intensity in the aroma and flavour of heavily roasted malts and light vanilla. Very smooth and rich feeling. Balance is great. Not too sweet.

Dark chocolate, cacao, very light, mellow coffee, dark, dried, but not too sweet fruits. Dark brown, medium, creamy, beige head. Light sweet. Creamy texture, dark chocolate fudge, sweet chocolate and light coffee, and yet quite dry and bitter cacao, dark fruits again, soft carbonation, full bodied. Beautiful Imperial Stout, exceptional well-balanced, subtle yet very complex. Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry.

small head coffee chocolate liquorice aroma. taste semisweet bitter chocolate, earth floral..palate is rosted malts long lasting sticky feel.
Very creamy, and for me it is a versatile beer, every time i taste it feels a bit different. This Also highly depends on the temperature

Uit de fles geschonken. Een prachtige imp. stout. Aromas van geroosterde mout, gedroogd fruit, chocola. Smaken van groosterde mout, lichte rook, gedroogd fruit, chocola, hout, koffie. Bijzonder complex, verschillende lagen en mooi in balans. Olie-achtige structuur en een heerlijke volle nasmaak die lang in de mond blijft hangen. 1 van de beste stouts die ik tot nu toe heb gedronken.

Pours deep black with thick brown head. Nose is chocolate and soy sauce. Aromas are roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, woody and nutty notes. Low carbonation, full body, thick texture. Long roasty, sweet and alcoholic finish. Well balanced and astonishing imperial stout!

Flaska på Rådhuskällaren/Rex, Umeå. Spanade in Rådhuskällarens utbud i förhand och var ett solklart val att testa denna. Svart vätska med två fingrar högt moccabrunt skum. Stor doft av fudge, kola, choklad och lena kaffetoner. När den kommit upp i temperatur även en tendens till grönt äppelskal och lite mer bäriga toner. Stor, len kropp. Kaffe, choklad, kola, lite körsbärssylt i bakgrunden. Lätt chark och rökighet i avslutningen. En välkomponerad, icke-extrem imperial stout. Vissa likheter med Great Divides Yeti. Rakt igenom bra.

Pours a pitch black color with medium brown foam. Taste has roasted malts, chocolate, toffee and a bit smoky character. Alcohol is present.Mouthfeel is silky and creamy. Taste has roasty/toasty characters, dark chocolate, coffee, toffee, no smoky presence, alcohol warmth, dark fruits and cherry notes, with an intense bittersweet ending.
Brillant, just a straight up Imp Stout, but completely balanced, soft, chocolatey, nutty, pleasant. Coffee...

(Bottle, 0
355 l - bottled 06/11/15, at BrewDog Helsinki, 20160601) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had burnt malts, liquorice, dark chocolate and ash. Palate was full bodied and oily with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, liquorice, sweetness, ash, hops and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt and bitter. A well done balanced imperial stout.

2015, lotto 15025, imbottigliata l11 giugno 2015, aperta il 31 maggio 2016.
Praticamente nera con riflessi caramello, schiuma nocciola di buona persistenza.
Aroma di caffè tostato, orzo, frutti rossi, in prevalenza lamponi, zucchero bruciato, cioccolato fondente, note di vaniglia, liquirizia e cannella.
Al palato caffè zuccherato, cioccolato fondente, frutti rossi, note di vaniglia, finale marcatamente tostato ed acidulo che riconduce al caffè, cioccolato fondente, tepore etilico, zucchero bruciato e note legnose.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata, decisamente corposa e ben fatta.

355 ml bottle. Black, with a thin brown head. Sweetsh roasted malty aroma, with chocolate, liquorice and fruity notes. The flavour is roasted malty, sweetish, with chocolate, coffee, liquorice, smoky notes and dark fruits. The finish is a bit drier, with bitter hops, ashy notes and some warming alcohol. Thick and smooth on the palate. Delicious.
Bottle. Black color with beige head. Aroma is liquorice, prunes, coffee, not so chocolaty. Taste is more liquorice and prunes, quite sweet. Silky mouthfeel, nicely light. A classic Imperial Stout.

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, tiny tan head. 
Classic stout, roasted at first, sweet notes. 
Full body.

Bottled:Pours black with a mid sized head. The aroma has loads of sweet licorice with smoked meat and biscuits in the background. Creamy and smooth mouth feel. The taste is quite sweet and the licorice shows up again. Then theres coffee and cocoa leading to a warming finish.Yummy!
Great stout. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, malty, smoked/burned aroma, nice hops, just a little sour at the end.

Bottle at VilleValla, Linköping. Pours black with tan head, a bit of lace. Aroma is slightly burnt with semisweet chocolate, molasses, dark fruits, dried figs. Smooth and oily on the palate; molasses, stewed dark fruits, a bit of roast flavour and almost no alcohol heat. Really really enjoyable, well-balanced imperial stout.

(355ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, May 10 2016) Pours pitch black with a small head of fine tan bubbles lingering with spotty lace. Aroma is semi sweet, nougat, molasses, moderate roast, stewed dark fruit, roast nuts, cocoa, slightly burnt. Flavour is fairly dry and smooth with a molasses and toffee core, more nougat, complex toasted grains, some fig, cacao, nutty, just a hint of smokiness. Finish is long, with lots of roast driven complexity. Medium-full oily body with below average carbonation and no alcohol heat. No adjunct bells and whistles, just a beautifully crafted straight-up imp stout. Very sippable and very drinkable in equal measure.

Jeden z pierwszych RIS-ów w Stanach Zjedoczonych. Pierwsze rankingi na RB są już z 2000-go roku! 
 Alkohol:  10,5% obj.
 Data butelkowania:  09.02.2015 
 Kolor:  Smoliście czarny. Zupełny brak prześwitów. 
 Piana:  Jak na tak kultowego RIS-a przystało pianę można zjadać łyżkami jak bitą śmietanę. Jest zawiesista, puszysta, drobnoziarnista. Po czasie drobne ziarenka przekształcają się w średnie, a nawet duże oczka. Piana bardzo długo faluje na powierzchni. Krążkowanie b. dobre, chociaż nie wzorowe. Kołnierzyk dostojnie podkreśla klasę trunku. 
 Zapach:  Olbrzymia moc słodkich składowych.
W pierwszym rzucie wychodzą na prostą ciemne owoce, w szczególności winogrona.
Zaraz potem duża porcja karmelu i gorzkiej czekolady.
Na dalekim planie nuty czerwonego wina i delikatny powiew szlachetnego alkoholu. Po ogrzaniu ujawnia się gigantyczny wręcz sos sojowy. Paloność umiarkowana. Aromat chociaż intensywny to z pewnością nie jest rzędu 10/10. 
 Smak:  Im bardziej skupiam się na początkowej słodyczy RIS-a, tym bardziej balans przesuwa się w stronę wytrawną. Początkowe tak słodkie nuty gorzkiej czekolady, karmelu, lukrecji i szlachetnej whisky zaczynają stawać się coraz bardziej wytrawne. Dużo tutaj również sosu sojowego, popiołu, a także tytoniu.
Goryczka jest masywna, długa, chwilami zalegająca. Bez wahania celował bym w +100 IBU.
Posmak palonego słodu i orzechów włoskich przez dłuższy czas paraliżuje język.
Alkohol dość wyraźny, jak po przełknięciu baryłek czekoladowych mocno nasączonych spirytusem.
Oleista, gęsta i ciężka faktura.
Jest przyjemnie, rozgrzewająco, dostojnie, ale trzeba podchodzić do tego piwa z rozwagą. Alkohol może tutaj sporo namieszać w głowie.
Potężny trunek! Wybitnie degustacyjny. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Solidny Imperialny Stout. Z pewnością nie dla każdego. Jest dość ciężki w odbiorze, chwilami mocno alkoholowy, ale z całą pewnością ma wciąż wiele do zaoferowania.
Nie uświadczyłem w nim grama tak charakterystycznej dla RIS-ów kawy.
Początkowa gorzka czekolada, karmel i lukrecja tracą z każdą minutą na swojej intensywności. Zyskuje za to wysoka paloność, orzechy włoskie, tytoń i popiół. Sos sojowy także staje się nieodłączną składową trunku.

Miałem ogromne oczekiwania w stosunku do tego RIS-a. Naczytałem się tylu wyrywających z butów opini. Myślałem, że będzie miazga. Piwo tymczasem jest dobre.
W moim mniemaniu niestety....tylko dobre.
A przy tej klasie trunku, to troszeczkę za mało.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black colour. Thin line of beige froth on top. Coffee beans, cocoa, chocolate, cream, hints if vanilla in the aroma. Milk chocolate and some cocoanibs at first. Slight coffee in the middle. Littlebit spicy. Chocolate in the end. Intensive roast. Very well bakanced, very well drinkable, not so heavy bodied, wonderful imperial stout.

Aroma has roasted malt, chocolate, salted licorice, coffee. Taste is huge malty and starts quite sweet but ends with long bitter and dry aftertaste. Flavors of coffee, licorice, caramel, dark fruits, tobacco, bitter elements. Oily mouth feeling. Intense in taste and excellent aftertaste. Outstanding.

Bottle, 355ml. A dark beer with a small brown head. Aroma is of coffee, chocolate, alcohol, nuts and some hops. Taste is bitter with a delicious toasted malt character. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, oily and smooth. Perfectly balanced aftertaste of floral hops and malt. An extraordinary Imperial Stout

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque with a large, frothy brown head. Deep roasted, dried fruit, hoppy, alcohol aromas. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich, smooth and creamy. Delicious chocolate and roasted character into a creamy bitter finish. Astounding.
