Strong licorice. Thick palate, almost like a Dark Horizon kind of extra strong IS. Some alcohol feel but not disturbingly. Very enjoyable.
12 oz bottle. It pours black with a dark brown head. It has aromas of chocolate, coffee, and cocoa. It has a rich, creamy texture with flavors of sweet chocolate, black coffee, and cocoa. Amazing!

355 ml bottle from Saveur Bière, pkgd 11/06/15. Thanks to Werckmeister!
Pitch black, oily body, with a small, dense, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of espresso, liquorice, soy sauce, cocoa, dark chocolate, tobacco, spices, vanilla, dark fruits.
Tastes of various, intense coffee notes, tobacco, wood, liquorice, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, dark fruits, some soy sauce, some hops.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes dry, roasty-bitter, wooden, with coffee beans, liquorice, tobacco, dry cocoa, spices, some soy sauce, some bitter hops.

Tasty, although I was expecting a bit more maybe. Intensely roasty-bitter and dry, almost a bit harsh, with lots of coffee and liquorice notes. Not my preferred kind of an Imperial Stout, I like it a bit smoother, while still a great style example I would drink again.
Pours black with a creamy tan head. Big, intense stout, that manages to drink incredibly smoothly. Loads of roast, treacle, earthy, moderate bitterness, moreish. Very good.

Pullo @ Saveur-Biere. Kaatuu snifteriin todellisena moottoriöljynä, paksuna ja sysimustana. Vaahto on niukkaa ja suht nopeaan katoavaa. Tuoksu on hieno paahteen ja lakritsin liitto, kupikin tasavahvana ja hienon täyteläisenä. Suklaata on myös melko reilusti ja hedelmäisyyttä on vähän tukemassa. Maussa lakritsi ottaa hieman vahvemman roolin, ollen osin salmiakkistakin. Paahdetta on, mutta jää lakritsin alle, mikä sopii minulle. Lievää tupakkamaisuutta ja hedelmää on myös joukossa. Makeutta on, mutta ei älyttömän paljon. Suutuntuma on paksu ja täyteläinen, alkoholi kutittelee myös kielellä ja olettaisin, että humalointi on ollut melko runsasta jossain vaiheessa. Hieno IS, laadukas, täyteläinen ja riittävän monipuolinen, että saa hyvän nautinnon. Lakritsisen puolelle kääntyvä, mikä sopii minulle paremmin kuin hyvin.

Botella. Presencia negra opaca con corona beige compacta y persistente. Carbonatacion media baja. Aroma intesnso a maltas torrefactas, algo de pan y licor. En boca perfecto balance entre alcohol y maltas, notas intensas a caramelo cafe y licor con un perfecto toque amargo para finalizar. Muy buena

20-MAY-2016, bottle @home, from Mikkeller & Friends Bottleshop.
Dense black with a high, lasting, lacing, brown head.
Dark dark aroma of malt. Taste is malty with molasses, chocolate, vanilla, dried figs, licorice. Huge body, sweet, soft carbonation, bitter from hops and roast. Fantastic brew.
Aroma is full of coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Pours pitch black with a tan head. Very balanced taste, bitter chocolate and sweet vanilla. Full bodied. Terrific beer.

0.355 l bottle from Saveur Bière, bottled in November 2015. Pitch black with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, brown head. Sweetish, roasty-malty aroma of dark chocolate, mocca, roasted nuts, nougat, some toffee and a bit of licorice. Sweet, slightly roasty-malty taste of dark chocolate, mocca, nougat, roasted nuts and licorice, followed by a long, roasty-bitter, slightly warming-alcoholic finish. Full body, very creamy and viscid mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not overly complex, but very intense and tasty. Superb mouthfeel, like drinking fluid chocolate. Delicious, although I expected a little bit more complexity, but the bottle might be too young for that.

Bottle@ Gambrinus, Tartu. Pours deep dark brown with medium brown head. Aroma: roasted, dark plums and berries, roasted, coffee, choccolate. Taste: medium bitter, coffee, roasted, some smoke sourness, sweet chocolate, Full body. Very well balanced. Nice one.

35,5cl bottle at Pudel, Tallinn. Pours almost pitch black with a modest, beige head. Ooh, rather intense aroma of roasted malt, lots of chocolate, some dark fruits, licorice, coffee and hints of caramel and spices. Certainly some sweetness too it, but complex and flavourful with a nice bitterness. Surprisingly smooth with well integrated alcohol. Yes, some waring alcohol, but quite well camouflaged. Excellent brew - and dangerously drinkable!

Pours pitch black with a thin line of nougat colored head. Aroma; Coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate and some dried dark fruits and plumes. Taste; Rich coffee flavour, dark chocolate, some vanilla and dried dark fruits.

Bottle - pours dark/black - dark tan head - taste cocoa light booze caramel sweetness - sweetness nicely balances the big bitterness on the pallet - bitterness hangs on a little longer than I'd like. Overall I love it!!

In the glass it is very opaque with a medium head. The aroma has some dark roasted fruits like plums and figs with some mild cocoa. Taste is smooth but big. There is some cocoa, licorice, oatmeal and some mild booze. Long smooth finish.

2014 bottle. This is exactly what a classic, non-barrel aged Russian Imperial Stout should be. Its big, full of flavor, and pitch black, but its also not at all aggressive, and it seems to just confidently let you find out how good it is without any gimmicks. Theres a lot of bitter chocolate flavor, but I was also impressed by the sweet malt / raisin flavor that they integrated as well. Just a great beer.

Bottle. Thick black with a medium/large dark brown head with good lace, retention and regeneration. Sweet nose with sugar, cocoa and dust. Soft flavour with chocolate, earth/soil/wood, cocoa, molasses. Full body, no alcohol showing, filling sweetness with balanced bitterness. Good.

Pretty damn good. Excellent presentation, with a decent and tanned foam and deep black color. Aroma is typical Russian Imperial Stout, which is a lot of roasted, and some coffee hints, between a heavy alcohol presence. Taste is excellent, very smooth and ballanced. Maybe more hopped than the average imperial stout, giving it a little bit of extra bitterness. Full body, dense texture, and a very long sweet and raspy finish.

According to Bells, this is one of the first Imperial Stouts to make an appearance in the U.S. As remarkable as that is, its even more impressive that its still one of the best. Expedition pours viscous and pitch black with a tan head. Dark chocolate, coffee, dessert wine, and burnt malt aromas. Tastes like cocoa, blackened malt, booze, caramel, coffee, black currant, leather, tobacco, black tea, and smoke. Beautifully smooth feel. Despite being a big beer, Expedition is exceptionally smooth. Its full-bodied and moderately warm, yet still a very easy beer to drink. Phenomenal.

0,33l bottle at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Brewed 11/06/15. Coffee, vanilla, cocoa, chocolate, maltiness, fruitiness and some sweetness in the aroma. Medium to thick body. Oaky notes, some alcohol as well. Complex and rich IS.

(Thanks, Gene! "Travlr")

Bottle.

A- Dark fruits, port wine, roasty, dark chocolate, subtle smoke.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Tobacco, leather, roasty, bitter cocoa, subtle espresso.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth dry finish.

O- Got this bottle fresh and painfully held back from drinking it to get about a year of age on it. Supreme beer indeed. Textbook perfection in just about every way. Beautiful all around.
appear black with a small brown head. caramel, chocolate, plum aromas, taste medium sweet medium bitter. full bodied soft carbonation. medium strong bitter finish
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Black colour with beige head. Roasted, dark chocolate, malt aroma. Sweet, roasted, dark chocolate, malt taste. Medium to full body.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2016 Flaska från Mikkelllers webshop. Ett öl jag väntat länge på att få prova. Lite annorlunda IS med mycket fruktighet jämte kärva tjäriga rostade smaker. Tännker lite Pannepot möter Kärv IS. Relativt söt, molass, torkade plommon och körsbär, mörk choklad med lite likörtouch och så en lite träig, tjära ton som ligger nära beskan i smakbilden. Det låter spretigt men fungerar riktigt bra ihop. Ritkgt gott och roligt att få dricka en av de första IS. Kanske tiden gjort den mindre unik men det är fortfarande riktigt gott.
Bottle.Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma of dark roasted chocolate and cocoa,oily and malty with flavor of dark fruits and coffee,nice full body and smooth finish.

Bottle at home in Richmond as Bells Expedition Stout, 10.5%, about 1 year old. Thick pour. Black, opaque with a dense foamy brown head, leaving full lacing. Aroma is roast coffee, toasted marshmallow, some cracked black pepper, light metallics. Body is a little frothy, soft carbonation. Taste is honey-ish, fudge, ash and salty pine, some boozy tang. Definitely has an American hop pine, resin and floral dimension going on. My girlfriend says it tastes like burnt-on animal fat scraped off a pan. I can see that. Its a tasty imperial stout. Im not entirely sure why this one does so much better than others on the site, but its very good.

Aroma and taste is dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla notes. Full body. Oily texture. Roasted bittersweet finish. Delicious.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma roasted malt, fruit, chocolate, toffee. Taste lactose sweet. Maybe a touch too sweet.

Superb and well balanced in all possible ways. Nice coffee character, dark choco, dried fruits, raisins, somewhat oaky. Very smooth and subtle. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness. Maybe not outstanding in any individual parameters, but overall superb

duft: ristet malt chokolade kaffe ristet brød
smag: sød. ristet kan chokolade stor fedme. kaffe svag ristet bitterhed. lang mørk chokolade kaffe smag

Negro opaco y espuma veis. Aromas se licor de cereza, chocolate, fruto negro. Cuerpo denso y sedoso, sabor achocolatado, licor, azúcar de caña, quemado que conduce a un amargor intenso aunque equilibrado.

Black with a finger of head that disappears completely. Fresh fluffy aroma very inviting, mildly sweet. Nutty flavor with floral bitterness that comes in waves. Not sweet at all as the aroma would lead you to think. Chocolatey bitterness remains on for a while. No frills, really rich and delicious example of the style.

Sporadic nougat colored foam. This stout is thick like oil, aroma of hard roasted malt, cocoa and some coffee. The taste is heavy and have a palate with both cocoa and coffee and a slightly roasted malt. Later evokes the taste a little licorice, figs and smoke. This is a very elegant and mellow, well-brewed stout which give time to long-term drinking. You should probably have tasted several stouts before embarking on this, for it is fierce and heavy. It is best to be enjoyed at room temperature, thus you get probably the most nuances in flavor. The alcohol at 10.5 can be tasted, but is saved well by way of the aforementioned elements. An Imperial Stout which is perfect if you like these heavy, rich and strong stouts.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 Bottle at home. Pitch black colour with a medium, fast disappearing brown head. Nose of cocoa powder and slight roasted malts. Taste is medium to high bitzerness, also cocoa with some roasted malts. Some alcoholic warmth bit very well hidden. Silk smooth mouthfeel with just perfect carbonation. Wow.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Very dark brown with a lovely brown sugar coloured head. Doesnt retain it for long. Body is full, creamy rather than oily, with the alcohol providing some chilli- like burn. More to the aroma than just coffee; I get figs, soy, dark chocolate, roasted malt and nut brittle. Flavour has lots of dark chocolate along with some licquorice and something slightly sweeter. Finish is hugely bitter, with lingering dark chocolate and coffee.

Bottle 355ml, a dark beer with low copper head. Nose is syrupy, sweet like, toffee, soy sauce, dark coffee, hazelnut, alcohol, a very complex nose. Aroma is on leather, oily, dark chocolate, mocha, resin, licorice, quite strong, grapes, very roasted, vinous, some wood touch. Finish is intense on licorice, soy sauce.
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 Strong aroma of coffee, licorice and vanilla. Thick in mouth like one can chew it. One of my favorite Stouts.

A pitch black beer, a head is small and dark brown. Aroma has liquirice, salt liquirice, riped fruitness and plums, sweetness, richness of malts. Taste is very intensive, roastiness, salt liquirice, coffee, some salt, balanced sweetness. Full bodied, not stickyness, low carbonation, smooth palate. Very powerful and intensive. The great and complex beer.
Dark, red, clear brown creamy foam. Alcohol, liqruish, coffee, chockolate. Sweet, bitter, pharmacy liqruish, with burned sugar aftertaste, growing burned aftertaste.
Black with medium brown head. Raosted malt aroma. Medium malty sweetness immediately followed bu roasted grain and strong hoppy bitterness. Dried plums notes. Fruity bitter aftertaste.

Bottle at home. Thick brown super stable head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, liquorice, soy sauce. Taste is cocoa, sharp bitter, bit of coffee, roastey malts, alcoholic. Needed some sips to start liking the beer. Well balanced and a very good imperial stout... Not getting why this is the 13th best beer worldwide though? Would like to try this aged!

Heavy bodied and viscous with muted carbonation. Pours like used motor oil with a small coffee-colored head. Sweet coffee, roasted malt, good baking chocolate, raisin, smoke, tart plum. Strong sweet and bitter finish.

Bottle shared with Niller, sourced from Mikkeller Bottle Shop, Copenhagen - pours black with tan head. Dark roasted malty aroma and taste, with prominent chocolate, some coffee, caramel, nice dark fruits, subtle vanilla throughout, roasted finish. Solid.

One and a half year old. 
Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, meat, toasted bread, dark fruits.
Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head that lasts very well. 
Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Aroma flavours are transferred very nicely to the taste. Medium full body, creamy mouthfeel, average to soft carbonation, roasty bittersweet finish. 
Lives up to its reputation!

Bottle. Pitch black pour with brown head. Aroma has toffee, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Texture is thick and dense. Taste is fresh and complex. Low carbonation. No hint if the high ABV. Extremely well composed

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Very dark brown color. Tiny size, bubbly brown head, stays. Roast, raisins, dark fruits, marmalade, orange, sweet and alcohol in aroma. Roast, dark fruits, bit ashy, raisins in taste. Spicy hops and intense roast in aftertaste. Bit harsh in a mouth. Boozy brew.
Flaske. Været på jagt efter denne Øl længe, derfor den fine rating. Lettere skuffet på en ellers helt fin imod, men så heller ikke mere. Overrasket over den med næsten 3000 ratings ligger så højt.

Bottle. Pours black with a little brown head. Aroma dark chocolate, subtle vanilla, roast, licorice, dark fruits, light soy, quite nice coffee, light alcohol notes, coaco. Taste is quite heavy, light roastey smoke, very oily texture nice coffee roast finish.

355ml bottle from shop.mikkeller.dk

15025 PKGD 11/06/15 C


Deep black colour with a tan sticky head. Coffee, dark chocolate, oak, creamy, smooth, strong, alcohol. Excellent slow sipper.

Bottle shared by Mart. Brown beer, small head. Nose is chocolate and vanilla, some citric hops, licorice and soy sauce. Flavor is thick, chewy, roast, chocolate, licorice, alcohol. Finishes with strong alcohol, citric hops, espresso, soy sauce and chocolate.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours black. Aroma is sweet, roast, malt, coffee, bready notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, coffee, malt, dark chocolate. Finish is roast bitter with some alcohol. Overall: very good.

Wonderful, even if not clear at all , aroma of dried fruits, licorice, roasted malt, bitter chocolate, sweet chocolate, hint of vanilla, cappuccino. Full intense black with Mocha head. Roasted malt, licorice, hint of milk chocolate, a lot of bitter chocolate, some chocolate, dried fruits. Wonderfull balance beetwen a strong bitter start and a light sweet interdetto before a coffee, licorice finish. Not bitter at all, not sweet but balanced with a lot of black Malta acidity in the after taste. Wonderful mouthfeel. Really Lovely creamy mouthfeel. A truly masterpiece.

Bottle. Black with brown head. Aroma of chocolate, licorice, heavy roastez malt. Taste is the same but whit some alcohol in the end. Medium to full body with oily and sticky texture. A bit to boozy but a great beer overall

deep dark brown colour, huge, dense brown head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of coffee, yeast (dried yeast extract) dark chocolate, herbal liqueur notes, some ash, roasted malt and earthy notes; taste of intensive roasted bitterness with cocoa, herbal liqueur notes, yeast, hints of salt and syrupy sweetness; brilliant imperial stout!

April 22, 2016. Bottle, bottled November 6, 2015. 
Black with a medium sized, slowly dissipating, dense brown head leaving a sticky lacing on the glass. Aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate, sweet and light salty licorice, blackberries, toffee, 
Taste is sweet, malty, soft roasted bitter. Finish is sweet malty with caramel, raisins, licorice, blackberries, some salty notes with a touch of soy, bitter cocoa, ash, lingering dry roasted finish. Full bodied, smooth, oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Great, solid imperial stout.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Lucky me: Im 2900th rater: Pours black color, clear, opaque with tiny unstable brown head with good lacing on the glass. Visually low carbonation. Aroma: intense roasted dark malts aroma, with notes of cocoa powder, cacao nibs, bittersweet chocolate, espresso coffee, molasses, vanilla and with hints of dark fruits in the background.
Flavor: intense, rich roasted dark malts flavors, with notes, mentioned above, supported with hints of bourbon and note of hops, which takes on citruses and dark/stone fruits.
Body is full, thick, texture is soft, very silky smooth, carbonation is low to moderate. This is hommage to imperial stout style!
After more than 50 bottles of different batches I must admit this is for sure best non BA imperial stout with super aging potentials - and
FOR F***** 3.29$ IS HARD TO GET BETTER BEER.

Pitch black pour with a medium height espresso head with decent retention. Smells like milk chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, cherries. Very smooth texture with low carbonation and taste notes that include espresso, roasted malts and dark chocolate up front, followed by a bit of caramel, cocoa and cherries and some vanilla in the background. Very well balanced and just the perfect mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 Bottle at bishops folkisz.
Pitch black, big thick brown head.
Sweet roasted coffee and chocolate caramel aroma, some oily alcohol, licorice, chocolate sauce, dried dark fruit.
Taste is sweet and sticky with chocolate sauce, licorice and tar and some plum/raisin fruityness. 
Full creamy body with soft carbonation and oily texture.
This is good. Very creamy and big but balanced. A bit too much licorice flavours for my personal taste though.

(35 cl bottle from Mikkeller Botlle Shop; Pkgd on 11/06/15) This beer has been on my wishlist for four years or so ever since I just missed it at Barley Wine so Im very grateful to Mikkeller for providing me with the opportunity to taste it. The beer was poured at fridge temperature (meter says 13 degrees celsius at the surface) into a footed Maisel & Friends tulip glass revealing a pitch black body with one finger toffee head. Decent retention and beautiful lace. Aroma has dark fruits, toffee and roasted malt along with some boozy notes that are however well integrated yielding a slightly medicinal yet pleasant result. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, full body and a sweet, warming finish. This is good stuff. Flavour is well balanced with dominant sweet component. Still some bitterness left in the beer after six months. Generally a very tasty and flavourful experience, which I find to be akin to stuff like Flying Dogs Gonzo although a bit on the sweet side compared to that.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 Restrained aroma in a treacle tar black pour. The taste profile is huge - with a thick malty licorice body perfectly balanced by a laid back sweetness that is perfectly complimentary. I wasnt expecting it when I opened the bottle - but I knew it was something special when I poured it. Quite simply a spectacular Imperial stout - spectacular!

Old rating.

Pours black with a good-sized brown head. Taste is creamy coffee, raisin, chocolate, and oats. Yum.

Taste is great, and the body gives a mouthfeel more weight than most stouts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341ml bottle from Craft Cabin. Aroma: great nose of chocolate, wood and a really subtle vanilla and touch of smokiness. App: pitch black, medium brown frothy head and awesome lacing. Taste and palate: full creamy, smooth body, some coffee in mouth, light but lingering for a really long time bitter finish. Overall: what a great nose. Nothing unpleasant in there. Only thing I appreciated a bit less is the everlasting bitter finish. But the aroma of this one is a real pleasure.

Draft to taster at cappys pour opaque black with thin tan head. At least this one has a head, every bottle Ive ever had of this beer has been flat as a pancake. Nose moderate roasted malt, earthy, almost boozy. Taste burnt malt, high astringent, molasses, raisin. All with the background of syrup. At least the mouth feel is nice. Ive had plenty of top 50 beers but this beer escapes me, I just dont like it.

Deep dark color with a two finger brown head. Aroma of chocolate, road times, oats and alcohol. Medium body. Chocolate and oats are predominant with an alcohol finish. If alcohol was not or slightly present I would have rated it higher.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle. Pours a dark brown and makes a medium brown head. Aroma is of chocolate, malt, and brown sugar. Tastes of cocoa, coffee, molasses, plums, and raisins. A wonderful example of a great stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Dark chocolate colored head. Rich boozy aroma with chocolate. Fantastic. I need it on tap.

Bottle from Craigs, dregs run, shared with AshtonMcCobb. Pours deepest dark brown with a thin tan head. Aromas of coffee and dark chocolate, dark stone fruit, booze. Taste is dark chocolate, boozy fruitcake. Oily texture, light sweet finish.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 12 oz bottle shared by DCLawyer, thanks Jason! Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of roast, chocolate, floral. Tastes of dark chocolate, caramel, coffee, roast. Medium full body with a dry finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours black, nose is chocolate, coffee, toffee, taste is similar, chewy, dry, sweet, thick.

Heavy dark brown, nice tan dusty film. Nose is oddly dark malty spice, a bit of chai but very tar choc. Initial taste is a chisled roast, meaty and a thick steep of malt. Carbonation is surprisingly punchy and the mouthfeel is creamy. Finishes smoith, light spice and a chewy fatty choc good time.Bottle fae Citizen Brock and Garvie 2014 batches from the same year, Pig Out Tasting.
Many thanks to CH-303 for this bottle! The beer is thick, deep and black. Malt, smooth, dark roast. Long aftertaste, plums, raisins. Extremely viscous. Great and deep!

Une bière dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina que javais vraiment très hâte de déguster. Même si cette bière nest pas bien difficile à obtenir, je me faisais un devoir de la déguster dans une circonstance choisie. Un liquide parfaitement noir et dune densité irréprochable. La mousse caramel brûlé se forme tranquillement, dabord en une pré-mousse des plus riches, ensuite dans une couverture noble et soutenue. Une fois la mousse réduite à un mince anneau, mon verre demeure taché de cette crème brûlée. Magnifique! Un nez qui me plaît peu ou plutôt, qui me déçoit. Je ny note rien qui vaille une 16e place au rang RateBeer. Des malts rôtis, de la fumée et une étoile de badiane, comme on en retrouve très fréquemment dans les RIS dEurope du Nord. Des grains de café grillés. En bouche par contre cest une toute autre histoire. Des saveurs évolutives soutenues par une texture crémeuse et onctueuse. Lattaque est marquée par un doux caramel presque salé. Puis suit une mélasse, un chocolat noir et finalement un café bien torréfié et amer qui persiste jusquà la gorgée suivante. Une bière délicieuse que lon retrouve presque partout à 3USD. Un rapport qualité / prix des plus difficiles à battre.

Aroma is dry, roasty, faint wood, vanillin, and alcohol. Heavy bodied and viscous with muted carbonation. Pours like used motor oil with a small coffee-colored head. Sweet coffee, roasted malt, good baking chocolate, raisin, smoke, tart plum. Strong sweet and bitter finish. Needs some age.
Caramel, chocolate, coffee. This is another example of greatness. Bells is a great beer maker. Pour is almost jet black. Aroma is bitter and sweet. Taste changes as it warms. Good stuff.
Coal charred wood aromas. Dark dark brown tan ring of head. Dry roasted chocolate charcoal slurps down like a velvet milkshake in the best way possible.

12 fl. oz bottle. Pours opaque black with a mid-sized good lasting brownish head. Aroma of dark roasted malt, intense chocolate and coffee, some wood. Taste of strong dark roasted malt, coffee, cocoa, chocolate, vanilla, warmy alcoholic finish.
Bottle to tulip. Jet black with a thin tan head and nice lacing. Aroma is malty, oak, coffee, and cocoa. Taste is roasted malts, licorice, coffee, vanilla, and cocoa. Thick and delicious.

Vertical flight at Hackneys Printers Row. 

2012 - smooth and nutty, bit of a metallic finish.

2013 - in its prime. Nutty, mellow coffee, sweet.

2014 - sweet, bitter ashy hops.

2015 - tastes quite young and green compared to the rest.

Bottled 9/11/15. Aroma is coffee, roasty. Black beerdark brown head. Taste is medium sweetness, medium bitterness,. Palate is full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish medium sweetness, bitterness and sweetness in balance.

Bottle from el cerrito, california. Black color, nice brown head. Aroma has smooth roastiness, chocolate, coffee, some vanilla. Full balanced body, chocolate, vanilla notes, nice hoppy end. Nothing special but nearly perfectly made stout.
Super dark. Raisin smell, with a good thick foam head from a strong pour. Good when temped up, but not a go too. Thick lingering taste that is a solid stout but not to my taste.
The best brew of the night. I couldnt even tell this was an imperial - so smooth and little bite with great chocolate and espresso.

12 ounce bottle, Batch #13592, packaged on 10/23/14. Served in a snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head that stuck around for a while. Theres also a lot of lacing. I like the aroma a lot, the brew smells like chocolate, dark fruit, molasses, coffee, and roasted malt. I think the taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but theres also some vanilla noticeable too. Mouthfeel/body is full, its creamy, smooth and a bit coating with moderate carbonation. Its been years since Ive had one, but its still as good as I remember it being. A classic, great stout that I really need to drink more often!

Almost a perfect appearance for a stout … black color and thick foamy dark brown suds. Deliciously smooth feel and heavy notes of chocolate and bark. Stouts like this the best because they don't have that bitter bite. 

- Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle. Pours black with thin brown head. Aroma is Sweet, Malt Chocolate. Taste is sweet chocolate malt with a warm chocolate finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Excellent beer.

Backlog, August 6, 2015. Thanks for sharing rlgk!
2012
Pitch black with a thin lacing head. Quite bitter with a nice saltyness and soy sauce. Very enjoyable!

12-ounce bottle pour. Pitch black with dark brown head that dissipates instantly. Aroma: earth, like dirt with earthworms and an ashtray -- yet in a good way! Flavor is rich; oily mouthfeel. Taste lots of sweet, dark fruits (figs, raisins, dates, molasses) at the forefront with a lingering prickly bitterness. Pleasing balance for a Russian Imperial Stout. Soothing alcohol burn follows. I love this beer.

Pours extremely dark brown with a lasting cream dark tan head. Nutty, roasted coffee aroma with slight hints of bitter dark chocolate. Flavor profile follows the aroma with a bit of alcohol burn. Good malty bitterness. Smooth thick creamy body. Bold slick, lasting roasted coffee aftertaste. Very nice lacing. Overall perfect brew for a cold winter day.

This isnt exactly a fair rating, but Im not really sure how to grade this. Right when its released, its very good. With a year or more on it, its amazing. Im rating based on how it is when its released, because "cellaring" at home could be hit or miss depending on your investment.
Aroma: Sweet caramel and light coffee. App: Amazing black with tan head. Taste: Bitter chocolate with coffee backing. Palate: Long dry finish. Overall: Delightful.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, from Wine Spot, Cleveland, USA. Strong almost pungent aroma of slightly sweet dark berries, licorice, chocolate, coffee and a hint of alcohol. Reddish pitch black color with small beige head. Strong superbly balanced taste with licorice, dark berries, coffee and somewhat roasted malts. Wide taste spectrum and medium/long aftertaste with coffee and roasted organic malts. Strong body with light/medium carbonation. Overall, superb product that perfectly combines sweet and malty flavors. Aroma could be stronger and aftertaste longer.
Soft cream head with a rich toffee aroma. Aftertaste is nutty with a bit of fig. and a sweet chocolate roast Havent had a beer this great in a while.

Bottle in LA. Pitch black thick pour with off white head. Boozy aroma, dark fruit. Flavour has dark fruit, mild cocoa and coffee. Creamy full body. Taste is mildly sweet, moderately bitter finish that lingers, ends with warming alcohol. Absolutely superb imperial stout.
Candied red apple, cherry, ashy/smokey, bittersweet chocolate, brownie batter, woody, grain husk, espresso bean lingering finish.

355 ml bottle, packaged 8/22/14, had on 11/09/15. Pours black with a thick, resilient, dark beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, burnt brown sugar, roasted hazelnut. Flavor is dark chocolate, brown sugar and figs. Finish is roasted hazelnut, coffee, ash, milk chocolate and mocha. Lingering roast, dark chocolate. Full body, velvety and oily mouthfeel, weak carbonation. Very, very solid!!
Nice aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, and plenty of sweet dark fruits. Taste is velvety dark chocolate and sweet dark berries, coffee, and just the right amount of hop bite in the end.
Nothing more to say. Well worth the $5 I paid for it. Strong finish. Sweet with a mixture of alcohol and molasses.

Pours almost black, brown head. Aroma of coffee, caramel
 Flavor of espresso, cola, toffee, dark fruit, hops, sweet intense finish. One of the best beers I have tried, any style.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: 12 ounce bottle.
Appearance: Jet black with a one finger head that dissapears quickly.
Aroma: Chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla.
Taste: Taste in line wth aroma, with some coffee/cocoa/nut flavors.
Palate: Carbonation is medium low, mouthfeel is dense, gets sticky.
Overall: Top of the line.

Aroma: roasty, chocolate, coffee, molasses Appearance: clear black, brown head Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, Palate: full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, damn, that’s excellent! Top of the fav list

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I sure didn?t expect what I saw coming out of this small bottle. Thick, creamy bree that I could nearly taste just watching it pour! And then it hit my tongue...heaven, I?m in Bell?s Brewery heaven!

Pours almost black, nice brown head fades quickly, excellent lacing. Aroma is heavily roasted barley, burnt coffee and cocoa. Taste follows. This is a nice bid thick chewy beer, one of the really good ones.

Bottle from K&L in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is vanilla, buttery dark butters. Taste is smooth and hard to explain. Not super stylized...no overwhelming coffee or dark chocolate. Just smooth, delicious. This is a stout among stouts. That perfectly weird pop song you love on the radio but cant explain why. A class of its own.
Bottle Shop at Hunger and Thirst Lancaster Pa. Lives up to its rep. Perfect appearance, smells great. Extremely smooth for such a high abv. Good brew to end the night with.

Go Lehigh. Lafayette Sucks. 2014 Bottle (13 months old) to goblet. Aroma is a lot of roasted barley. Hints of coffee also. Appearance: Dark black color, very thick, with thick light tan head. Taste: bitter dark chocolate, roasted barley, maybe a touch burnt. Excellent beer though. Feel is thick and meaty. Not quite as tasty as some other stouts, but all the peripherals are on the mark. Excited to age a few of these further.

Pitch black pour with a lasting beige head and good lacing.
Nose: espresso, licorice, dark chocolate cake. Sweet molasses. Cigar box nose. Taste: full sweet molasses and roasted malts. Straight forward, old school impy. Rich texture. Roasty, malty molasses and very mouthcoting. Coffee, licorice and medium bitterness in the finish.

Pours a very dark brown with a coffee froth head. Aroma isn't very strong, mostly toffee. Taste has alcohol bite with a strong roastiness. Mouthfeel is thick, but not very creamy. Alcohol and hops bite on the front end. Alcohol follows down the throat and hops linger on the palate. Apart from the high ABV, this one is definitely a one and done for the night. Great beer, though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark charcoal colored beer with a late forming billowing root beer float head. Nose of cocoa powder, dark coffee, and aged balsamic vinegar. Flavor is rich with burnt pumpernickel, espresso, and prunes overlaying a smoky charred bitterness on the finish. A bit of acid hits at the end too. Extremely flavorful, but one at a time is more than enough.

12 oz bottle - pours motor oil black with and a thin tan head. Complex aroma of espresso, dark chocolate, anise, earth and tar. A taste is even more layered with flavors of chicory, burnt toast, chocolate, licorice, peat and a bitter coffee finish.

Terrific RIS. Pours black with a tan head. Smells of big roasted malts. Taste is the same with notes of chocolate and nuts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amazing. Pours a deep dark medium foamy one. Aroma is of dark chocolate, cocoa nibs and liquorice. Taste is of creamy melting dark chocolate, liquorice. Gently roasted caramel malt. Mouth feel is full bodied and creamy rich. Aftertaste is bitter, hoppy and an interesting heat, but not overstaying. All flavors are complex and so well accomplished. Extraordinary RIS for sure.
Awesome! The pour is jet black with a little tan ring for a head. Aroma is beyond belief. A full, thick body.

Just like the deScription. I drink a lot of Imperial Stouts. Yeti aged in Bourbon barrels, Big Bad Baptist, the Czar, etc. This one deserves the rating of 100. Simply delicious. Chocolatey, flavorful and screams for a scoop of ice cream!

Aroma: roasty, chocolate, coffee, molasses
Appearance: clear black, brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

damn, thats excellent!
Very big stout. Warms the tongue. Rich mouthfeel, thick, the booze it there but tucked away. Classic.
Great large production imp stout. Might be a little more subtle in taste than previous years, might just be me.
Black. Loads of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, hints of booze in aroma,. Full bodied. Moderate sweetness, coffee, more roasted malts, range of medium-dark chocolates tastes.

Bought September 22, 2015 from a liquor store shelf, bottled February 2, 2015, enjoyed September 23, 2015 in a Hopslam tulip/snifter. 

Look - Dark black. Very slow to develop a thin tan head. Settled to a ring with light froth laying on top. Speckled lacing.

Smell - Coffee. Char. Dark fruit and plum. Licorice. Tootsie roll. Caramel. Light hop.

Taste - Char. Hop. Chocolate. 

Feel - Light heat. No bitterness. Smooth. Heavy mouth feel. 

Overall - I let this sit on the shelf and finally bit. Liquor store aged. Very nice. I liked Black Note so not surprised I liked this.

After the embarrassment of showing up to a party a day early, I got over it when I shared one of these with a good friend. This, storm king, and old Rasputin are the 3 best ever

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a premium beer. Picked up two six packs at Harrys in Grand Forks ND. Boy, was I ever glad I did. They must not sell much of this in ND, because it was aged two years. Awesome!

12oz bottle. 2014 vintage. Had/have MANY vintages of this consummate example of the style (97 is still the best). Great w/10 months on it but better with age. Rich, hoppy, chocolatey goodness! Full+ body and full-carbonation.
33cl bottle thanks to bytemesis. Thanks man! Dark color with thin brown head. Medium thick smooth body. Medium high bitter, light sweetness. Flavour is liquorice, chocolate, nuts, coffee.

Bottle shared by "hannont". Colour...very dark brown with no head. Nose...brown sugar, molasses and dark chocolate. Palate...quite dry and ashen with lots of dark chocolate and burnt sugar. Theres bitterness on the palate and dryness on the finish. This was a 2010 and has held up well!

Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede goudbruine kraag. Ruikt vol, vanille, crème, bitterzoet. Beetje alcohol, chocolade. Smaakt vol, bitterzoet, koffie, vanille, crème. Beetje drop-achtig. Mooie volle bitterzoete nasmaak. Dikke structuur. Fantastisch!

Originally reviewed 3/15/2013. 12 oz. bottle poured into a snifter. Batch 10068, 12/17/2010. Inky viscous black that yields only the slightest tinge of brown at the edges. Not much of a head. Thin khaki collar around the edge with just a lonely dime-sized island of foam roaming the surface. I can smell the molasses from the open bottle. Tons of molasses. A stronger sniff unveils booze, licorice, and ashy burnt malt. Taste is molasses again. Really creamy in the middle with just a little bit of sweetness and then the onslaught begins. Licorice, dark fruits, the darkest chocolate. Burnt pieces of chocolate, really. Ashy and extremely bitter. Booze comes back at the last gasp and bites the throat. Low carbonation, boozy, nearly acrid in its ashy bitterness. And yet it manages to be creamy and delicious. Every complaint I have ever had about fresh Expedition Stout has turned into an attribute in this bottle. Two years has done this very well.

It pours black with a dark brown head. It has aromas of chocolate, coffee, and cocoa. It has a rich, creamy texture with flavors of sweet chocolate, black coffee, and cocoa. It packs a bitter sweet punch on the palate.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 1 year 1 months old. Pours black with minimal light brown head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: roasted dark malts, coffee, chocolate, caramel, alcohol, vanilla, herbal hops, molasses, slight bourbonish, toffee, spice, soy sauce, earthy and candied sugar. TASTE: rich dark roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, caramel, herbs, citrus, alcohol, vanilla, spice, smoke, soy sauce, toffee, molasses, dark fruit, slight bourbonish and hop bitterness. AFTER TASTE: dark chocolate coffee bitterness, spice, molasses and dark roasted malt with an oily thick rich boozy finish.

Probably the darkest, thickest, maltiest stout I've ever had. Really hoppy with a great aftertaste. Really heavy but really tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thick and inky with large foamy tan head. Chocolate and a light wisp of alcohol on the nose. Taste- wow, incredibly rich and chewy. Roasted chocolate malts slam your taste buds. Less dominant flavors include honey, coffee, raisin, tobacco and alcohol. Giant Stout. It's easy to see why stout lovers love this ale so much. It's really good but just not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours thick and rich, with aromas of dark chocolate and roasted malts. Little to no head retention. Very warming and decadent. Drinking this in July, not usually the style I go for, but I didnt have the will power to wait for cooler weather.

Smells of alcohol and faint hints of chocolate and coffee. Low carbonation with a sticky syrupy mouthfeel. Lightly foamy. Taste is dominated by the alcohol, but of course also has the typical stout tastes present as well such as raisins, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Aftertaste is long length and the same. You get immediate warmth from the alcohol and taste of alcohol that subsides over the course of about 20 seconds. Too boozy for me. Gets significantly better with age though.

bottle to pint glass from....poured jet black with a effervescent brown head, complex flavors of caramel, chocolate and raisin, with a thick creamy with of a slight burn of alcohol to finish the sip. I would like to lay a few of these down, and update the review.
12oz bottle pours a thick dark color with a bit of brown head. Silky smooth and lots of sweetness. Loads of flavor. Chocolate and berries and plums. Medium hop bitterness at the end.

Bottle, aged 2 years. Poured thick, black, with little head. Aroma was of roasted malts, dark fruits, coffee. Taste was complex, roasted malts, dark fruit, slight bitter chocolate, hops, coffee, moderate bitterness, full-bodied, strong. Overall a great stout.
poors a dark black with a tan head. has aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, and hops. tastes are identical plus dark fruits.

Two years old. Nose is dark fruit and sweet syrup. Flavours are espresso, sweet syrup, dark fruit, bitter chocolate, maybe some leather. Bursting with Flavours very drinkable. Taste big sweet med/big bitter. Full oily body with medium carbonation and lasting bitterness. Awesome beer, no doubt about it.

Bottle to snifter, dark black with tan head, aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, hops, and plum, taste is similar so strong and powerful, one of the best for sure

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Ginger Man cons 2015-05-16 New York
AR: bourbon vanilla, roasted malt, coffey and chocolate
AP: black, stouty dark colored head
F: dark bitter chocolate, black coffey, spicey tropical fruitinees from rum barrels, dry, rich and complex brew, very warming feeling (alcoholic and spices) - great!

Packaging date of 08/22/14.
This was poured into a mini snifter.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a less than a fingers worth of foamy tan head that dissipated within less than about 30 seconds.
The smell had a big roasty to semi-smooth bitter coffee bean leading into a delicate cocoa and light vanilla to round it all out.
The taste was pretty smoothed due to the date, Im guessing, still a nice roasty smooth coffee and cocoa delicately weaves together to lead to a decent sly roasty aftertaste and finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a good sessionability about it. Carbonation definitely smoothed a bit with a nice drying edge leading into a rounded out stickiness over my tongue.
Overall, I can only imagine what this is like when its fresh. It aged beautifully and I hope to have again some day hopefully fresh.

Bottle from Marco. Jet black with a coffee head. Aroma is dark fruity malt. Flavour is bitter chocolate, spicy, dark fruits, creamy peat finish. Coffee cream finish, with a bit of stinging booze at the end.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 2015/05/05 - Pours a dark brown cola colour with a thick, creamy, khaki head that lingers and laces nicely. Aroma is burnt sugar, carame,l dark berries chocolate, coffee and a little vanilla. Taste is sweet burnt sugar, chocolate, dark berry notes and coffee. Moderately sweet and some solid bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium and oily with smooth carbonation. A long drying, bitter finish with some nice alcohol warmth. A little more boozy than I typically like, but still a pretty amazing stout. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What can I say about Expedition Stout besides mmmmmmmm.....? This beer is absolutely delicious. The flavors are so complex and intense and they continue to build as you sip through the glass and let the beer warm and breathe. More than half of the bottles in my beer fridge are Expedition Stout that I cleaned off the Total Wine shelves as soon as I found it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Massive thick coffee and caramelization, both in aroma and flavor. Perfect carbonation and mouthfeel. Alcohol warmth was a nice addition to flavors as well. Finishes with dark fruity dry flavor.

Glorious aroma of berries, juicy, red, forst berries, in wonderful bitter chocolate. Oily looking, slick and resinous in the mouth, not much of a respectable brown head, flavours of dark chocolates, vanilla, berries, very bitter, even herbal, not as much as many other US imperial stouts, but enough to slightly spoil it - I dont like herbal bitterness in stouts. Great beer, I must admit.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 One of the most classic and critically acclaimed American imperial stouts. Very dark mahogany brown colour, almost black but still transparent on the edges in the end and in that sense a bit less dark than many other imperial stouts, under a dense and creamy, cappuccino-like, tan head with good lacing and good retention; the beer itself also leaves thick, oily, yellow legs, as expected. Powerful bouquet rising up from the bottle upon opening... I put my nose above the snifter and I find myself in beer heaven once again: the purest fondant chocolate, ristretto, candied dates, raisins, brown bread, some baked banana, charcoal, fine cognac with a fine cigar, something pleasantly and refinedly sourish not unlike balsamic vinegar but very subtle, bayleaf, subtle vanilla notes, mocha ice cream, fine hints of peat, fermenting soy sauce, pine wood, even something flowery and a very refined and subtle sweetness reminiscent of tawny port. Pointy, aristocratic taste, with a noble, restrained candied sweetness in the onset, very light sourish, salty and umami accents all working perfectly well together, oily and supple mouthfeel, not too sticky as is often the case in this style, soft carbonation exactly as it should be, with prickly little stings to the tongue, providing perfect balance with a powerful, profound yet still relatively light and elegant maltiness, deeply nutty and bitterly chocolatey, a bitterness which becomes even more powerful when the roasted barley appears in full strength, leading to a very pungent, creamy, mouth-lining, deep bitterness embellished with some floral and resinous hops and gently, but deeply warming, bourbon-like alcohol. The fine, powerful but still delicate, almost woody and nutty espresso bitterness remains in the back of the mouth for hours...  In my quest to find the best stout (or beer, for that matter) in the world, this gets eerily close: the word balanced may be used all too often, but here it clearly is no cliché. You can feel that this brew is made with the greatest care; there is not one flaw in it, every part fits in perfectly... Gracious sweetness pops up, makes room for a deep bitter tone, and so the play goes on.  This is one of those authentic, Id almost say historically evocative executions of the style, it makes me feel Im at the court of the czars, like the aged Courage Russian Imperial Stout did when I first tasted it. This stout is so cleverly made, it does not need any further additions, no barrel ageing, no weird ingredients like chilli peppers or whatever; not cloying, no burning alcohol in the finish, good head formation - and retention, noble, elegant, restrained, this achieves near perfection to my taste. Yet, I still have to taste that Black Note version, waiting in the cellar, so Ill refrain from giving it a perfect score - for now. Wow... Im sure anything else Ill have on my tasting table tonight will only be trivial compared to this. Fantastic.
Heavy aroma of dark chocolate and roast. The taste is like the aroma heavy with a lot of taste os chocolate, roast and coffee without being sour. Perfect balance!

Bottle. Opaque black with thin brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, light burnt sugar, and a hint of coffee. Heavy body, roasted and burnt malt, chocolate, some alcohol warmth, moderate sweetness, and a bitter finish.
Thanks to Benzai. Schenkt een zwart bier met een mooie bruine schuim kraag. Ruikt gerijpte fruit, koffie, pruimen. Smaakt drop, geroosterd, koffie. Heerlijk dik, plakkerig.

Wow, this is a huge beer. Very dark pour, with a thin, dark tan head that quickly disappeared. Big, dark, sweet aroma of sweet, dense chocolate and alcohol. Nicely bitter, lots of chocolate that is bittersweet at best. Drier than a lot of stouts, a hard sweet burned sugar flavor that is more flavor than sweet. Very pronounced alcohol burn, could have been more subtle. Beautiful bitter -malty finish that lingers for a very long time. This is a giant, satisfying beer that is complex and just slightly too alcohol forward.  I  expect that this would age beautifully and moderate the booziness.
Heavy hitting imperial and lets you know it. Rich and black. Been a long time since I had it.abv will knock you out but its easy enough to drink and not notice.

Frankly when fresh this isnt nearly a 100 percentile beer in my book as the alcohols are to assertive and its a little unbalanced, bordering on harsh, but is a wonderful even great brew. However Im drinking one aged 6.5 years and its easily one of the best flavors my mouth has ever experienced. AMAZING! Full, round, faded roast, mildly figgie with hints of stone fruit, dark sugars, mildly earthy, sweet malt forward yet drinkable. Dangerously delicious, now if only Bells would age it 5 years before release! Soy aromas, dank fruity aromas, mildly nutty, very grainy/malty. Mmmmm!!!

A friend helped me bring back two 12oz bottles of this to Hong Kong for me from the US. They were packaged on 9 October 2014, so around 6 months now. The beer poured pitch black into a snifter with a one finger brown head that dissipates in less than a minute leaving some spotty lacing. First were strong chocolate smells followed by sherry, malt and pine. The alcohol also does come through at times. Tastes begins sweet with chocolate and malt, then turns bitter dark chocolate, pine with a herbal-ey lasting finish. Like the nose, the alcohol is there but leaves a warm feeling. It is full bodied, light to medium carbonation, warm and sticky. I only got 2 bottles of this and this was the second bottle. As per the description on the bottle and brewery website, I wish I had more so that I could age it and compare the differences it would make. Having said that, 6 months in, this was nice.

12oz bottle. Oh My God. Pour is near perfect. Thin circular head surrounds a dense,almost opaque, pitch black beer. All the elements are there (roasted malt,expresso,chocolate,licorice). The list goes on. A little alcohol heat on the palate .Mouth feel is rich and creamy with lingering bitter dark chocolate. Hard to find anything wrong. Rating scale needs to offer half"s. Would have wanted to give this beer a little more, but not comfortable with whole point on any of my scores. Should have gotten more than one. A year or two in cellar and wow.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Re-rate October 18th 2015. Short re-rate. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized brown head. Aroma is malts, dark chocolate, dark fruits lightly, dark malts. Taste malts, dark malts, slightly roasty, but damn theres a lot of chocolate there and not to mention a firm to heavy malt chocolate bitterness. Awesome! Way better than when first I tried it! I guess it does mature and develop as they say. Really enjoyed this one, superb! -- Original rating: 8-5-8-4-16 (4.1): Bottle [from trade with mista] @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus, Joes, Martinus, Ansjelaah and Judyvv. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized dark brown head. Aroma is malts, roasted malts, liquorice. After it warms up for about a half hour (since it was pulled out of the fridge) the aroma also gets some liquor, a hint of vanilla and possibly a hint of oak. Taste malts, roasted malts, dry, dark chocolate, bitter, some alcohol. Again, after warming up for quite a while some other flavors come through like vanilla, dark fruits and malt and hop  bitter. Full body, suitable carbonation. Good beer for sure, but not one of my ultimate top ones.

Bottle @ benzai. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head. Smells roasty, slightly salty, slightly liquorice, deep. Tastes roasty, alcohol, hint of bourbon, very earthy, some liquorice, wiebertjes. Full body, soft carbo.
Bottle @benzai. Black color with a small beige head. Smells and tastes sweet, drop, roasty, chocolat, caramel.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2016 2016 re-rate: 2015 bottle aged for a year. Pours a pitch black with a small rim of brown foam that lingers. Big molasses, toasted sorghum, deep cacao and light coffee on the nose. Roasty on the palate, roasted cacao nib and sorghum. Deep, roasted flavors. A little roasty bitterness on the finish. I think another year would mellow this out a bit more. Old rating. Bottle from Old Town. Dark black with slight ruby highlights and a thin brown head. Great lacing throughout. Aromas of roasted espresso, cacao nibs, blackstrap molasses, fig, and dried prune. Creamy mouthfeel with a full rich flavor. Full bodied with light carbonation. Cacao and coffee flavors are most pronounced but as it warms up to room temperature more of the dark fruit flavors become evident. Great smooth finish. World class Impy that deserves every bit of the hype that surrounds it.
I don't think this is as great as everyone else does. Bells does great work but I am not in love with it.

Bottle at home while visiting Jacksonville. Bottled 18/09/14. Pours a deep dark brown/black with a slightly pinky tan head. Sweet aroma of candy choc, liquorice, burnt sugar, dark sticky fruit, malty fruit cake... Medium to full body, light to medium carbonation. Big, rich and sticky with soy, teriyaki, dark sticky fruit, treacle, bitter choc, coke, coffee, rum, light grass, light cherry, a little boozy heat. A little harsh maybe... A tasty tipple which makes me keen to try an older bottle. If this was smoother/more rounded/mellower I can imagine it would be knock-out.
12oz bottle. Pours thick black with almost no head. Aroma is slight alcohol with some malts and sweetness. Taste follows with really nice finish. Awesome brew.

Pleasant aromas of coffee, dark malt roast, toffee, espresso, dark earthiness and a slight liquid yeast scent. Appearance is black with a very thin brown foam. Taste is very thick with an extremely heavy black malt characteristic upfront followed by notes of thick chocolate syrup, toffee, coffee roast, roasted malts, burnt caramel, espresso, dry earthy malts and dark wort. Finishes moderately boozy with more roasted malts and coffee roast. Overall, this is a really really nice Imperial Stout with a huge body and complex flavors. A+ rating.

Opaque pitch black with a smallish brown head and very nice viscous lace. Wonderful bittersweet chocolate and roasted coffee aromas with rich dark fruit and molasses. Chocolate and coffee stand out in the flavor profile, with subtle contributions from molasses, figs, chicory, booze and smokiness. Beyond full bodied, creamy silky smooth mouthfeel, minimal carbonation, and a decadently lush rich finish.
Oh my god! So good!!! I can't even explain how good it is! Wow wow wow wow wow wow

Bottle to snifter large frothy dark lasting head with excellent lacing. Heavy aroma of bread,malasses,roast ,coffee, and chocolate.Full bodied with a creamy texture, thick sticky mouth feel, with a long finish. This is Beer!
Taste and smell of coffee and cacao, deep dark brown color, look thick but right texture. somewhat bitter, taste good and not fade off when it warms down. Another great beer from Bells.

From a 12 oz bottle with date 08/22/14. Pours a thick, black color, with just the slightest deep brown highlights on the edges, and a dark brown, thin head, the darkest head Ive seen to this point. Smells just chocolately, kind of roasted chocolate granola, just a little alcohol there. Taste is incredible. So chocolately, roasty, but that oatmeal is still there. I dont believe they use oats in this, but Im getting oats. And the mouthfeel is incredible. So luscious, full, smooth. I was blown away the first time I had this. One of the best standard imperial stouts available.

Bottle. Pours jet black with minimal brown head. Aroma is roasty with some slight hints of booziness. Heavy coffee and dark chocolate notes with some sweetness. Heavy and thick on the palate with roasty finish. Very good.
Bottle at Torst, New York. Colour is deep black with almost no head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, dark chocolate, some coffee and roasted malts. Lingering taste. Quite amazing in fact.

Strong alc. With chocolate and a fruity taste. Will let the others age a little. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft. Black with beige head. Chocolate aroma. Really smooth chocolate and dark fruit taste. Very fine beer.

The best of the year and the best of the year and the other hand is the only thing that would have to go back and the 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour at home, thank you Andrew for sharing this one, black pour thin head , big bold aroma of dark chocolate very slight alcohol aroma, so much flavor smooth chocolate, slight wood taste. This is a good beer, such a pleasure trying this.

12 oz bottle poured. Pours jet black with a swirling tan head. Wonderful chocolate roast aroma. Absolutely wonderful. In my opinion, this is exactly what a stout should be. Talk about a beer that is hyped, and lives up to all the hype, plus much more. Flavor is a really nice milk chocolate, with a medium roasted flavor to it as well. Doesnt come off as boozy in any way at all. Almost a bit of vanilla that sneaks in to an otherwise chocolate filled finish. I cant wait to give this one some age. Perhaps the best stout I have ever had, and ranks up there with the best of beers as well. Incredible stout. Absolutely love this.

Pitch black in color, minimal tan head... Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, dark chocolate... Anise is prevalent... Flavor is roasted malts, licorice, dark chocolate, dark fruits... Exquisitely balanced and smooth... One of the best non-BA IRS available....

This is about as intense as a stout can be, but I think its about one step too far for me to consider perfect. The body is pitch black with a dark coffee head that sticks to the glass, much like the thick, almost syrupy liquid will stick in your mouth. Its like a chocolatey whiskey wine with all the tastes hitting hard and simultaneously.

It formed a think brownish head on it that formed in sort of a delayed reaction after the pour into a mug. It has a strong whiskey-like aroma and flavor. Very flavorful. You can tell it has a high ABV when you take a sip. It might be too much for some people (my wife doesnt like it), but it is a treat if you like the flavor of barrel aged stouts. I suppose the whiskey flavor could be too much for some (not everyone likes whiskey).
Pours black with brown head. Heavy body. Flavors of dark chocolate, dark fruits, coffee and lots of roasted malts. Leaves a roasted coffee flavor in your mouth.

Bottle. Not aged. Black w thin brown head that quickly goes. Coffee chocolate aroma and taste. Sting bitter malt. Slick mouthfeel from the alcohol. Nice lingering finish. Look forward to our some down to age. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle from 8/22/2013. Pours jet black with a nice cinnamon colored head. Smells a bit of caramel, light chocolate notes, roasted malt and a hint of toffee. Tastes a bit sweet up front with some chocolate and caramel notes, with a bitterness that quickly follows. One of the finer stouts I have enjoyed.
A rich flavored dark stout. Initially tangy and almost sweet with a strong "barrely" taste at the end. Definitely a must taste for a stout lover.

Bottled 10/23/14. Pours absolutely pitch black. One of the darkest beers Ive ever seen. Tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, lots of chocolate, some coffee and some licorice maybe? Cherry? Little bit of booze comes through. Amazing Aroma. Flavor is deliciously dark roasted malts and chocolate. Little bit of licorice. The mouthfeel is so incredible. It just fills up your mouth. So full bodied. Bitter coffee finish. Top notch imperial stout.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Bottled in Sept. 2014. Tasted on 1/16/15. Color is pitch-black. Deep tan head, 1/2 finger. Smell is soy sauce, deep wood and chocolate notes, molasses, licorice. Taste is bittersweet, creamy, French roast coffee, charred wood, cocoa nibs. Long drying finish. Only the barest hint of dark fruit flavors/aroma. Not bad, but Im more interested in how this tastes with a year or two on it.

Tasted 8/22/2015. Pitch-black, almost no head. Smell is chocolate/cacao, sorghum, rich syrupy character. Taste is smooth, a little bitter -- coffee, cocoa powder, cacao nibs, deep stone fruit flavors, charred wood, but the hops come across strong as well -- theres a floral, piney presence to all this. Really interesting and will only get better with time.

Thanks to tderoeck for the bottle! 

Poured into a teku glass, showing pitch ink black and very little if any latte foam that fades into swirls in the glass. 

The nose is complex - a lot of bourbon and charred wood. Generous notes of dark chocolate and coffee beans. Also lighter hints of vanilla. 

The palate shows an oily, slick, impossibly smooth, and light body. The first impression shows a lot of the bourbon, and smoked wood with light hints of the dark chocolate. The mid palate matures into more of the bourbon and smokiness. The finish shows a noticeable but short sweetness akin to vanilla or a milk stout and a strong but not overwhelming espresso bitterness. This is a really tasty sipper. Very curious to see how this ages.

12oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. Bottle packages on 8/22/14.

Pours dark black, completely opaque. Small layer of mocha head on top. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, plum, roasty, subtle alcohol complex. Taste is chocolatey bitter upfront, but not over powering. Very subtly sweet undertone. Mouthfeel is rich and full. Smooth texture. Long silky finish. Theyve obviously got this beer dialed in after many years of producing it. This beer only improves with time.

Pours deep black with a thick foamy dark brown head, and a thinner light brown foam on top of that. Aroma and flavor are chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt in a perfect balance with neither dominating. Exceptional stout, indeed.
BIG! Hard to believe its a six pack imperial stout. ROUGH! Alcohol in the nose and finish. Im putting the other five in the cellar, should be FANTASTIC in a couple years!

12oz bottle from October 2014 poured into a snifter.

Pours an inky black with the look and consistency of used motor oil. Leaves a quick glimpse of a tan head that quickly fades away. Some nice splotches on the sides of the glass.

Aroma really jumps with coffee, dark chocolate, and prunes. A bit of a charred character hinting at the roastyness. 

The flavor when cold is really bitter with a tartness that surprised me. As the beer warmed, however, this smoothed out considerably and everything just seemed to meld. Coffee, char, and dark fruit just seem to be married perfectly with just enough bitterness to keep the sweetness in check. Incredible mouthfeel that is silky smooth and the alcohol is barely noticeable. 

Overall, an incredible RIS and very drinkable. Really hits all the high points of the style and is quite delicious.
This is really freaking good. Probably my favorite of the midwestern heavy weight stouts like Darklord and Bourbon County.

Bottle by Cuso, thanks! Aroma rich malty, coffee, sherry-like, raisins. Pitch colour. Taste is once again rich dark malty, chocolate, roasted, toffee, raisins, very nicely balanced. Also quite easily drinkable considering the ABV. Alcohol hidden well. Excellent.

Bottle by Cuso, many, many thanks for this one. Pours dark brown color, small beige head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee, cocoa, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, vanilla, coffee, plums, dark chocolate, cherries, lot of dark fruits. Very nice sweet cherries in the end with warming alcohol. Great beer, great one...

Pours jet black with big tan head. Aroma is roast and chocolate. Big heavy malty body. Lots of roast and chocolate, dark fruit, little smoke. There is a pretty big bitter hoppy bite also. And some alcohol. Very big beer, yummy.

I tried this is a series of imperial stout and it finished right around the middle of the pack. Good competition, though, since this was a fantastic beer in its own right. Deep coffee character, some licorice and lingering bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 beer tastings...jesse...i have been wanting to try this one for awhile....picked up a sixer...pour is black with a nice creamy bubbly head....nose is dark chocolate and berries....mouth is same....very smooth beer....velvety and delicious....way stoked try...gonna cellar one bottle....rerate in a year...
On tap. A really nice imperial stout. Layers of roasted and chocolate malts. Balanced bittersweet flavor, alcohol very well hid.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2015 Pleasantly surprised to randomly find this renowned brew on tap; Expedition Stout had been on my to do list for a while and it did not disappoint. Poured a thick jet black with just a hint of reddish hue, long lasting dark khaki head. Aroma of coffee bean, chocolate malt, maybe some fruity (cranberry?) notes. Smooth and full-bodied on the palate, a solid thick beer that truly meets that "meal-in-a-glass" description. Taste is mostly rich coffee with a little dark chocolate, not as complex as others as claimed, but still enjoyable. One of the most impressive aspects of this brew was the minimal booziness despite the high ABV, finished refreshing with no tartness, a at least in my experience. No less creamy or flavorful from the bottle, impressive! Actually a bit of aging in the bottle strengthens the chocolatiness.

Pours a thick black with tight 1/2 inch dark brown head. Aroma is licorice, dried fruit and toasted bread. Flavor is dried cherry, brown sugar, roasted malts, some hops are still lingering. Alcohol is more dominant in this fresher bottle (8-22-14). Finishes more dried fruit and lots of roasty malt. Age makes this beer near perfect. I have had more than 75 of these and they always deliver. Top five beers that are not rare. Unadulterated goodness!

Bottle pour into snifter. The bottle is from September 2013 - so just over a year on it. This is a wow beer. Kicks up an excellent inch high brown tan head. The deep dark color here and appearance is outstanding. No major nose until this warms - at which point woody and tobacco notes come out. Mouthfeel here is creamy and full without any stickiness. Dried fruit - raisin and fig come in on the palate. Roasted and dark chocolate notes provide a grounding without overwhelming the balance here. Walnut and tobacco on the back end. A real treat.

Poured from a 12oz longneck bottle into a nonic glass. Opaque black colour, brown foam, lasting with lace. Malty, bready, toasty, caramel, toffee, kacao nibs, extremely roasty, lots of burnt grain bitterness to blend with the hoppy bitterness. English-style hop flavours: earthy, flowery, woodsy. Tannic, tart, reminiscent of cherry pie, plum wine, smooth alcoholic warmth. Medium-heavy body, well-rounded mouthfeel, moderate carbonation, complex long-lasting aftertaste. Here is a perfect example of how good Russian Imperial Stout can be WITHOUT any bourbon barrel aging or any kind of trendy flavour additives. This beer is as delicious as everyone says. Highly recommended.

Bottle on 12/21/14. Pours jet black with a thin tan head. Nose is dark fruit, chocolate, licorice, soy sauce or beef. Taste is sweet chocolate, dark fruit, some coffee, brown sugar, so good. Mouthfeel is thick and gooey. Amazing.
Really good stout. Has a really nice aroma and a nice roasty taste. Looks great and easy to drink.

Aroma is very coffee and chocolate with hints of vanilla. Appears coffee bean brown, thin ring of foam, minimal lace. Tastes of sweet milk chocolate, then some coffee, then fades into bitter dark chocolate, the ending is like dark chocolate melting in your mouth. Overall, beautiful.

Tap. Pitch black. Some minimal head/lacing. Nose of pure roasted malt. Full, rich body. Tastes of sweet chocolate, roasted coffee, mild raisin. Very rich and roasty. Tastes strong without being too boozey.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2015 Bottle from GreatDane1632, many thanks, man. Almost black color with medium beige head. dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, cocoa beans. Taste, dark malt, coffee, dark chocolate, rum raisins, vanilla, licorice, Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Excellent sipper.
Appearance is small tan head with very dark color. Aroma is sweet chocolate malt. Taste is creamy chocolate and roasted malts with a kick of alcohol. Overall a very solid stout.

2014 bottling, via Justin D. Pours a dark opaque brown/black, decent amount of creamy looking tan head. Aroma dry and earthy, baking chocolate, cocoa. Body full and roasty, with a surprisingly sweet finish, caramel, figs, dates. Not my all-time favorite, but understanding of the ratings.

Picked up a single bottle at Vintage Estates in Boardman, OH. Poured straight down the middle of a snifter, very thin light brown head that dissipated quickly. Pours like old motor oil, and I mean that in the best way possible. I appreciate the wide range of aromas that people detect in this, but all I smelled was dark chocolate. The whole beer smells like a 70% cocoa chocolate. Surprising amount of carbonation up front, taste is very bitter. Obviously very roasty and malty, but theres some pininess about it for sure. On the back end all that classic Russian imperial stout stuff shines through: coffee, chocolate, date, plum. Really heavy mouthfeel, to be expected from a beer that is nothing to trifle with. Gets much better as it warms. Overall, a bold take on the style that doesnt make me feel like Im drinking alcoholic hot chocolate.

12 oz bottle. Tasted on 12/11/14. Bottle from Lukas Liquor Kansas City. Pours to a jet black color with a small dark tan head. Aroma had light chocolate with coco & dark fruit. The taste was smooth with a mild bittersweet flavor of chocolate raisins, dark fruit & a slight boozy finish. Overall one of the best stouts I've had the pleasure of trying. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2015 I am cellaring a bunch of these so bear with me on this. I have had both a fresh and one year old side by side last evening. Both poured into their own snifters, respectively. Beautiful black base with uniform dark khaki heads on each. Aromas of roasted coffee, cocoa, dark bittersweet chocolate, figs, licorice and brown sugar. The fresh snifter was definitely a touch more bitter, the year old had the "edge" taken off a bit. I would also say the year old was just slightly more sticky in mouth-feel maybe a little sweeter as well. Towards the end I blended the two together and finished up. Surprisingly not as bitter in the blend as well so that was nice to see. You need to get some of this Imperial stout if you?re able... the quality is with the best of them and for the price per six pack you really can?t go wrong. Put some aside and enjoy the Expedition!

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2016 Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small mocha brown head. Aromas of dark sweet fruits, pretty big malty notes coming up, fruity coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, light salty licorice. Taste is more malty up front, salty licorice, dark fruits, raisins, fruity coffee, very dark bitter chocolate, heavy roast.

Pours jet black, almost oily, with thick, red tinged, dark brown head. Aroma is semisweet chocolate, cocoa nibs, wet grain, almost coffee. Taste is boozy, hot alcohol but also bitter chocolate, burnt toast, sorta sweet at the end. Very nice mouthfeel, thick, chewy. Overall great stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing brew. This one taste of cocoa and it looks spectacular. Enjoy my friends.
Pitch Black, rich and creamy with medium brown foamy head that sticks to the glass. Very smooth and flavorful with no harsh aftertaste.
Really good stout. Maybe the darkest beer I have ever had. Very smooth despite being a 10 plus percent beer. Complexity increases as it warms.

Aroma is roasty, woodsy with some black licorice, light booze, raisins/dark fruit and a faint hops scent. Also some coffee notes present. Quite possibly the best looking beer I have ever seen - absolutely pitch black with a miniscule dark brown head, very clingy and sticky on the side of the glass. Pours out remarkably thick. Tastes roasty, slightly charred, hops are surprisingly subdued and ABV is masterfully well hidden. The only booze heat is in the aftertaste where it is most welcome. Some bitterness and dark fruit. I am not getting any licorice in the taste like some other reviewers. Palate is spot on. Thick, oily with a remarkable mouth feel. Overall a great offering by Bells. I cant wait to see what it tastes like with a few years of age on it. Now if I could only get my hands on some Black Note Stout.
Jet black. Creamy dark tan head. Charred. Real dark chocolate. Heavy. This would be incredible w strawberry or oats.

Dark pour with lots of lacing and a small dark head. Bakers chocolate and a little smoke on the nose. Lots of nice deep fruit flavors, cherries, dates, orange rind, earth, meat, cinnamon, tobacco, and a touch of salt on the finish. Really delightful stout with long and revealing finish.

12 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at room temperature.

A: Pours almost exactly like Old Engine Oil, a thick, viscous black. Almost no head formed with my pour, with what did appear a deep tan. It quickly receded to a ring and patchy cap. No light gets through this beer. None. Not a speck of it, anywhere, along any edge.

S: The smell is roasted chocolate malt, with notes that remind me of a bourbon barrel, oak and booze. Theres definitely some dark fruits playing around in the background as well, like midgits running along the hills the FSM made with His Noodly Appendages.

T: A rush of darkly-roasted, burnt-black bitter chocolate malt opens the taste,which quickly transforms into a swirl of flavors. Seared molasses, espresso, cherries, prunes, and figs all dance about the mouth, atop a stage of dark earth bitterness with some pine needles mixed in. Theres some alcohol burn involved as well, particularly on the back and finish.

M: Oily, thick, chewy, and sticky, this is what a good RIS should drink like.

O: This is a darned good RIS. Being a malthead, Id have loved to see a little less showcasing of the earthy-pine hop flavors, which are noticeable and sort of horn in on the malt profile. This beer also did not hide its ABV at all to me, though the bottle was only three months old - perhaps the burn fades with more age.
Bottle from Maltitude. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, and dark fruit. Taste of chocolate, vanilla and molasses, along with chocolate and coffee. Excellent imperial

Tap; pours black with a thin mocha head; aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruit with hints of molasses and vanilla; taste is sweet with chocolate, dark fruit, and molasses then becomes bitter with a hint of coffee; finish is light dry bitter; excellent imperial

Poured from bottle into snifter. Dark opaque brown with very thin light brown head around the edge. Smells of dark fruit, sugars, the slightest hint of coffee/ chocolate. Complex flavor with more dark fruit and sweet malt, with more evident chocolate notes, a little bitterness in the finish. Full body, with a nice smooth feel. This beer is pretty much perfect, as far as Im concerned. Great flavor, great balance. Probably my favorite beer ever.

Bottle 35cl as an extra from elyts_dlo, thanks dude! Appearances is jet black with no head. Aroma is raisins and roast malt. Taste is more raisins, bitter (dark chocolate and coffee) with an edge of saltiness? Could be alcohol harshness though. Medium bodied. Theres a pleasant chocolatey bitterness to the finish.

Bottle - 2 months old - Pours very dark, no highlights, with a beautiful, creamy head. Aromas of dried fruits, figs, coffee, chocolate, and peaches. Wow, what a mouth full, creamy with some much going on sweet dried fruits, chocolate, coffee, some bitterness and a warming alcohol before a smooth finish. One the best beers in the world.

Appearance: Black, dark tan head. Oily. Lots of thick, dark tan head. 
Aroma: Coffee, dark malt. Raisins?
Taste: Strong coffee, bitter, very dark malt, roasted, burnt. Nice, but a bit harsh.
Bought: Total Wine & More (Sterling), 355 ml, $2.99
Info: 29/10-2014

355ml bottle @ home, thanks to Douglas88. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, bourbon, raisins, chocolate, coffee and toffee. Flavour is roasted and medium bitter. Full bodied, texture is very thick and oily, almost extreme but I like it. Carbonation is soft. Finish is incredible complex, very roasted, bourbon, medium bitter and long coffee taste. Wish I had more.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Firestone pint glass
From: Barons Market in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $1.79
Purchased: Oct. 22, 2014
Consumed: Oct. 29, 2014
Misc.: Packaged on Aug. 22, 2014 with unlimited shelf life

Poured blackish, even dark purple, color with 1-to-2 fingers of frothy, khaki tan head. Went from a pour to calm and serene in about 12 seconds. Surprisingly very light spots of foamy lacing on the sides of the glass. Also below average retention on the top all the way down. (Sight - 3.88)

Smelled booziness up front, initially reminding me of a mudslide - vodka, coffee liquor and Irish cream liquor. Also the usual suspects - caramel, toffee, milk chocolate, roasty malts, nutty malts and cocoa powder. A tad like a chocolate milkshake, too. Not too bad on the nose. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste was about what I expected, albeit a bit rougher and earthier. Got boozy coffee liquor and Irish cream liquor up front. Also toffee, caramel, chocolate milk, bitter roasty malts, roasty nuts, earthy chocolate syrup and crayon. (Taste - 3.88) 

Full body. Sticky-to-slick texture. Average carbonation. Long, warming finish. (Feel - 4.38)

A pretty good RIS. Im usually a sucker for these types of beers, but I dont think this was great. Just pretty good. (Overall - 3.88)

3.95 89 B+
Roasted aromas, dark chocolate, coffee, wood. Very smooth and full body. Dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, vanilla, cocoa nibs, good hop balance.
